reviews.review: Quick Trip across to Cozumel. For $12.00 round trip, a great ride across the ocean to do more shopping. Took approximately 30 minutes and provided either an open ride on the upper deck, air conditioned lower deck and the ability to have a cocktail while enjoying the ride. Neat to see Cruise ships in passing!

Smooth ride. We went from Playa to Cozumel using them and went from Cozumel back to Playa a few days later on MarCaribe. Would def recommend them instead. The ride was way smoother. On the ride home we all had headaches and wnated to hurl! Ultramar had a fun badn to entertain us, the ride was outdoors so we really got to experience that beautiful turquoise sea and they had snacks, drinks and beer for not too much money. Wiould use them again. Buy your tix from the booth and not the people trying to "help you" down the sreet

Rocky Ferry Ride. On the way the ferry was fine, the music was entertaining and the boat didnt leave on time, was scheduled for 11 and left around 11:15. They said it was the newest and fastest boat however Caribe left on time and got to Cozumel on time.Coming home the waters were extremely bad, the wind was blowing and the swells were no doubt about 6-8ft high. The boat was rocking and alot of people were seasick. The Caribe left on time as well, this ferry did not.

Told us the wrong time then refused to give a refund. We purchased tickets in a hurry at 12:30pm because we were told by the representative at the stand that the next ferry left in an hour (1:30pm). After we purchased the tickets we drove 7-8 minutes to the dock to find out that the next ferry does not leave until 3pm. Their company office is approximately 20 feet from the dock and therefore I walked to the office and requested to speak to somebody. Their best offer to a solution was they could refund me half of the money for our ride to Cozumel (and could use a different company) but that we had to return with them (UltraMar). I continued to ask for a full refund and they stated I had to go back to the stand I purchased the tickets at, I refused to walk that distance to receive a refund and miss the next ferry at 2pm (time offered by a different company). We were able to convince them to send a representative to us and we needed them to arrive quickly but they took their time. It was not until 2:30pm they decided to give us a refund, and I took the money and purchased the next ferry at 2:45pm from a different company. When we finally arrived at Cozumel at 3:45pm we found all the beaches were closed at 5pm. We only got a chance to eat and returned back to Playa del Carmen after the sunset and it was dark. We lost the day and sunlight due to this company not providing proper service. DO NOT USE THEM!!!

rocking and rolling ride but super easy. we have always wanted to ride the ferry over to Playa Del Carmen, so we finally did it on our last trip there. The ride was great! However be prepared for a rocky ride if the seas are rough.The service was great and the boat was clean. You should know that if you sit up to you can get wet!! Nice crew!!
Nice & Easy. We were lucky that the UltraMar ferry was leaving within 10 minutes of reaching the dock. A nice and comfortable way to travel to cozumel!

Bien . Good service. Muy buena opcion para cruzar desde Cancun a Isla Mujeres. 2 opciones muelles para Cancun, Playa Linda y Playa Caracol (zona hotelera) Por 14 usd de costo, llegas comodo en butacas a tu destino. Con pantallas de tv. Si bajas en pkaya Caracol quedaras muy cerca dek Mall Forum.Very good option to cross from Cancun to Isla Mujeres. 2 docks options for Cancun, Playa Linda ( Torre escenica y Capitain's Jelly Rogers) and Playa Caracol (hotel zone) cost $ 14, you get comfortable in seats to your destination. Tv screens. If You choose Snail beach it's close of Mall Forum, downtown near artisan market.The crossing to Cancun takes about 35 minutes

Great boat and axcillary facilities. This is a very good size terminal for the area. It could use some more clearly marked English language signs for the majority of the visitors to direct you to the correct locations and for the time tables. Otherwise, a couple of shops for refreshments and other travel goods. Great place to people watch if you got a little extra time on your hands or for a quick nap in my case after scuba diving all morning off Cozumel. The actual ferry was in great condition and plenty of seating for all the passengers. Does get busier in the evening compared to morning departures.
Pretty straightforward. Not much to review. The advertise wifi but it never works. At times the band can be annoying, so stay inside.

always choose Ultamar. have traveled several times back and forth over the years between Coz and Playa and have always chosen Ultamar. They are always have been on time when I have left both very late and early.

Like a fine aircraft, plus photos with a Mayan warrior.. While many prefer to ride on top, the air-conditioned interior was like riding first-class in a jumbo jet. During the ride to Cozumel, a young man in full Mayan regalia posed with travelers for photos. On my return, I noticed a full-service bar and purchased a cold drink which was most refreshing. The cool air and comfortable seats were what this old body needed.

Limited times to get back to cozumel. Almost missed our cruise ship because the ferry left late. They seemed more interested in selling drinks than on time service. Luckily the boat waited for our group. Not impressed. We tried to get on an earlier ferry but all the men said was "it's impossible".

Great ride. Awesome staff they waited 15 minutes before departing due to our bus load of athletes and bikes all arriving a few minutes late. Was nice and cool sitting up in open decks and the island by night looked beautiful

Commute to and from Cozumel. My wife and I were staying in Riviera Maya for our anniversary and had family visiting Cozumel at the same time. We decided to take the ferry over to visit them one day. My wife doesn't exactly love being on big boats because she gets motion sick. We decided to sit on the middle deck which is outdoors. Much to our surprise they offered snacks and drinks (for an additional fee of course) and a full band playing really good music. All of this kept her mind off of being on the boat and made it an enjoyable trip for both of us. I would highly recommend this ferry company over the other two options.

Easy process. Avoid all the "salesmen" go straight to the ticket office which is near the boarding area. We were able to ride in the top open air area both directions. Great no fuss service! Clean bathrooms too!
Great fun live music nice ride nice view to Islas Mujeres. Great fun live music nice ride nice view to Islas Mujeres. Great view. No long waiting. Comes every half an hour

Standard ferry. Between Cozumel and Playa del Carmen there are several options. All pretty similar but at different times and prices. Check each ticket booth for the option that suits you the best.The boat had indoor air conditioned and outdoor seating.

UltraMar Ferry crew saved our vacation!. My wife accidentally lost her wallet on the 7am trip from Cozumel to Playa del Carmen on Tuesday, August 30, 2016. We didn't notice it until we reached the bus station where we had intended to take the Airport Bus to Cancun. We panicked and rushed back to the boat which was just about to return to Cozumel. My wife explained what happened to the person who was supervising the boarding. He graciously allowed my wife to run down to the boat to search for her wallet. As she rushed to the boat he called the captain on the radio to ask for some time and help. Once my wife boarded the ship she looked in vain for the wallet. Tears came to her eyes as she realized that it must be lost. Then almost miraculously a crew member descended from the bridge with the lost wallet. One of the crew members apparently found it and immediately took it to the captain for safe keeping. We can't thank the captain and crew enough for their kindness and help. We enjoy scuba diving on Cozumel several times a year and part of the fun is the ferry ride. It's amazing to us how friendly and nice the people are in this area. We feel so comfortable and welcome. Thank you so much for making our vacation a memorable one. We love you! Steven & Katherine

Easy. Decided to do off the cuff. Cheap easy ( band on board were excellent) air conditioning could not fault. 45 mins ish they run every half hour and signs up everywhere. Tip don't book return as it makes for a more flexible day.

Ferry from Cancun to Isla Mujeres. Take a local bus to Puerto Juarez (look for the sign in the front window of the local bus). Another option is to take the R-1 bus to downtown Cancun and board a combi (little van, at a nominal cost, for the rest of the way to Puerto Juarez). At Puerto Juarez, exit at the first stop, walk through the huge parking ramp, to find the ticket office for the Ultra Mar ferry. They do not accept charge cards. There is an ATM machine there if you don't have pesos. Taking the ferry that departs from Puerto Juarez to Isla Mujeres is much cheaper than going on the ferry that departs from the hotel zone to Isla Mujeres.

Nice ferry ride to Cozumel. We took the ferry round trip to Cozumel, The staff was nice, boat was clean and nice and a good band played going both ways, Our return trip was made during a large storm so it added excitement, but it was still fun for all of us.
Smooth and quick ride, I recommend it. Reasonably priced smooth ride over from Cancun to Isla Mujeres. What can you say about a ferry but I have to use 100 characters so they will post this.
Quick trip to the Mainland. A comfortable trip from Cozumel to Playa del Carmen and back. Air conditioned, full bar and snacks, comfortable seats. A 45 min trip. $10 each way.
On time, comfortable. We use this ferry to go from Playa del Carmen to Cozumel and back, staff was very attentive with my mom needed special assistance. On time and comfortable spaces.

Comfortable and fast. Good option to cross between Playa del Carmen to Cozumel and vice-versa. Good service, with a full bar and waiters going around offering snacks and drinks. A/C which is key in the heat of the Yucatan peninsula. In little under 30 min you make the trip.
Alex . Got advice to take this Ferry to Catano... Super cheap only $1 round trip and you are transported to a different town and safe 👍🏾

Great time!. About a 45 minute ride from Cozumel to Playa del Carman. Had a live band on board that was very entertaining. On the ride back - same band and had mixed drinks and snacks for purchase. Would definitely ride again!

It's a ferry and then some. Ok it's a ferry from playa to Cozumel. If you want to sit in a/c, they have it. Want to feel ocean breeze, check. You want some sun, A+✅. Entertainment? You betcha. We got the ferry to and from with the same Cuban karaoke dynamic duo. On the way to, very entertaining. Coming back, it was the same set list but if you took video of the female performance, it may be a little NSFW. Hey, anything for tips, right? One word of caution, do not get a car rental from playa for Cozumel. I won't go into it but if anyone from the ticket booth wants you to rent from Iguana Tours for a car, don't do it. It was terrible. There are many car rental services in Cozumel once you get off the ferry and the prices are very reasonable. But again do not let yourself be led to a little office behind the senor frogs. Big waste of time.

It's a ferry. It got us to Isla Mujeres in about 20 minutes. Not sure what else you can say. It's a boat, it didn't sink, and it was quick. I did have luggage with us and the staff took it from us and loaded it into its own area with other luggage so I didn't have to carry it, that was a plus.

good value. My wife and I wanted to visit Cozumel so we took the ferry over , it took about half an hour , on the way over we sat inside but on the way back sat outside , outside is the best way, we saw a dolphin on our return trip, not expensive , fairly frequent , trips and excursions are offered on board if you want to do anything on cozumel. Drinks are for sale also if you need one .
To Isla Mujeres. Took the ferry over to Isla Mujeres. Great view of the water. Sat inside going over and sat on top coming back. Best seat up top. Great views and wind blowing to cool you off.

Great service. We used all 3 ferry services while we were down there and thought Ultramar was great. Ultramar and Mexico Waterjet are about the same price - more expensive than the other one. The thing I liked better about Ultramar is their outside seating was better. But in all honesty, I would take whichever ferry was leaving the dock first.

Amazing ride! . We always travel via UltraMar Ferry over to Isla Mujeres from Cancun. The first good view of the spectacular blue water when we arrive in Cancun. Air conditioned! / or ride on top in the sunshine and breeze. The staff is willing to help you with your luggage. The new port on Isla is very nice too. $9 ( US dollars) per per person round trip. Only about a 20 minute ride, and red room available. You can buy your tickets at either port terminal.

Got us to and from Cozumel on time and on budget!!!. We decided to leave our rental car at a lot in Playa Del Carmen and just use the people ferry over to Cozumel for our 3 night stay. Glad we did. The round trip ferry service for a family of four was $57 USD. One trip on the car ferry for a family of 4 was quoted as $80 for just one way. So, this was the way to go. Plus, cabs in Cozumel are regulated so fairs are predictable. They checked out large bags as we neared the vessel and baggage claim after the trip was easy. We sat upstairs in the open area where unbeknownst to us they have live 'entertainment'. A karaoke version of the song and the performer sings. Not bad since it's included. If this is too loud or bothers you, just head inside! Drinks were good and were affordable. All in all we will use UltraMar again when we head back to Cozumel.

Ferry trip to Cozumel. After using all three regular ferry services to Cozumel during a recent diving trip, not sure I have a significant preference for any of them, hence the average review. Trips were fine, seas were relatively calm, and none of the ferries left on time (all within 10 minutes of schedule). Ultramar had the best outdoor seating on the big second deck with plenty of covered seats. Not being a catamaran, Ultramar probably is a bit slower but didn't really notice since we sat outside both trips.

Excellent water service . Since we spend our vacations on Isla Mujeres, riding the Ultramar is mandatory. Fun and accommodating, plenty of snacks and drinks. Always a decent guitarist to entertain for the short ride over.

We take the ferry everytime. We frequent Playa del Carmen and take the ferry across to Cozumel every time. It is our favorite thing to do. It is fairly quick, 30-40 minutes and comfortable. My daughter tends to get sea sick and she had managed to avoid it on the ferry. It is never really busy so we can spread out and get comfortable on the ferry and relax for the ride. There is a video that they show on a big screen, it has good air conditioning, and there is a guy or gal that come around with snacks that you can purchase. You can also take you snacks with you when you board the ferry.

Fast and timely Ferry between Cancun and Isla Muejeres. It is a 20 minute (beautiful) ferry ride from Cancun to Isla Muejeres, leaving every 30 minutes at the top and bottom of the hour. The cost is around $8 round trip. I purchased tickets through their website a few days ahead, where they send an email voucher that allowed me to pick up the tickets once we are arrived at the terminal in Cancun. I am not sure how much time this saved us, but this is an option.The Ferry only holds 250 people. Get there early, say at least 15-20 minutes before to get inline (with tickets), so that if the boat fills up that you do not have to wait for the next boat.There are two levels: the top is open (outside) and the bottom is inside with air-conditioning. They ask if you have wet clothes or item to seat upstairs. If you have luggage, you will be asked to store them at the back out of the boat, so remove any valuables before getting onto the boat, since you will be separated from them during the trip.They do sell snacks and drinks on the ride.

Loved it!!. Its great to take the ferry over to Cozumel!! It takes 45 minutes each way and I recommend you buy a one way. Why? IT time restricts you from all that you will want to see AND IF MISS IT, YOU HAVE TO BUY ANOTHER TICKET !! It runs 365 days a year and on the hour 6am-10pm

Fast and innexpensive. We traveled round trip from Cozumel to Playa del Carmen. Fast and inexpensive. The trip across is about 35 minutes. Leaves you off in the center of Cozumel and Playa del Carmen.
Must do . We use the ferry every time we are in Playa. It is always on time and a quick way to visit Cozumel for the day! Oh and it is very inexpensive.

Great Ride!. Our group of six took the UltraMar Ferry to Cozumel. We wanted just a short visit of a few hours. The employees told us the best times to travel to avoid the cruise ship tourists, which was about 4 in the afternoon. The ride was smooth, the scenery breathtaking, and the entertainment was thoroughly enjoyed by all. I would recommend UltraMar to anyone who is looking to visit Cozumel.

Excellent.. We took the ferry from Playa Caracol. The first ferry at 9am and we come back in a 4:pm something ferry. No issues, a very nice trip. Only a little advice. My husband did not read that the ticket says "Do not separate the sections" and ripped the ticket for boarding the ferry with the intention of saving the return section in his wallet. Do not do that! Some guy in charge scolded us "Pero porque lo ripio!!!" and the lady that was in charge of boarding too. No idea why because the different section of the tickets have the same serial number, indicating they were part of the same ticket. That was the only little issue. We felt safe, the ferry is clean, it was in time and we had a very good time in Isla Mujeres.

Fast and fun - worth the money!. This ferry was only a five minute walk from our hotel. For $19 US round trip, just the ferry ride alone was worth it! The downstairs is covered and air conditioned, and upstairs gives the most incredible views. I kept taking pictures of the water! It leaves every 30 minutes and takes about 20 minutes to get to/from Cancun Isla Mujeres. A perfect day trip with my husband and 8 year old son.

Fast, friendly. Nice and big, indoor/outdoor sitting.We sat outside and we had a live band play on our trip to Cozumel from playa.They drinks, snacks for sell also, did not leave on time, but I was fast and felt safe.

on time and easy!. This ferry from the Hotel Zone to Isla Mujerles was super easy to find and ran right on time, every hour on the hour to the island, and every hour on the half hour back to the Hotel Zone. The reps were friendly and answered all our questions. Seating available on the top level if you want sun or in the cabin if you do not. Snacks available for the 20 minute ride. $19 per person round trip.

Live entertainment now, both ways. My girlfriend and I were staying a week in Cozumel and decided to go to Playa Del Carmen for a day.When we got to the ferry ticket office across from the town square, there were not less than three people that spotted us as dumb tourists and ushered us to the ticket window where there was no line and several clerks. The tickets were $8 one way which is crazy cheap for a ferry boat. It was very well organized and the people were ultra nice and helpful. We went out on the open air area of the upper deck, and, to our surprise, as soon as the boat was underway, an entertainer appeared, a guy in dreadlocks but dressed very nice and he sang songs like Frank Sinatra, mostly in Spanish. He had his own amplifier set-up and apparently worked for tips.On the way back, there was a four man rock ensemble and they were great. They played a variety of rock music, mostly sang in English, and we loved it. We gave them a generous tip, and they handed me a CD.Very very fun pleasant trip. You have a choice of ferry companies, just pick the next one to leave.

Smooth ride. It cost $10 US each way. The ride is a little over 35 minutes. The view is fantastic, especially if you see a cruise ship. It's cool to see the giant Mexican flag at the Cozumel dock. There was live music on both trips and snacks available. Well worth a day trip to the island. Check out the museum just a few blocks from the pier.
Clean and smooth ride. We had our luggage with us and the staff helped out the entire time stowing it and having it ready for us as we departed. The ferry was clean and we quickly got to the island.

Fast and efficient . We stayed in Puerto Juarez a stones throw away from the ferry and rode it almost every day while here. It's fast and efficient. 146 pesos (~8 USD) for a round trip. Inside is air conditioned. Upstairs is a nice view. Sometimes there is a man with a guitar playing. Avoid.

Beware of Pre-Paid Tickets. First, the ferry was on time and very clean. They even had entertainment on the upper deck. I have no complaints at all about the actual ferry service which is why I'm giving it four stars. However, I purchased round-trip tickets for 8 people through my credit card using points from their reward program. We were able to board with no problem going to the island. Coming back was a different story. They kept saying they couldn't find the reservation and we actually missed one ferry while they fooled around with this. Since we were flying home and had to meet the shuttle, this didn't sit well because we were held up for 45 minutes. One of the employees even told another we were lying in Spanish but my friend knew what she said and called her out on it. They finally allowed us to get the tickets which we had already paid for. If the company is going to offer this kind of deal, they need to be prepared to honor it - we were not going to pay for tickets twice. I'm sure buying tickets there would have been no problem.

3rd time in 2 years - always good!!. We've been over to Isla from Cancun 3 times in 2 years with two kids & we've used Ultramar from both Gran Puerto (X1) & Playa Tortuga (x2). Both were very good rides, even in a rain storm this last time! Highly recommend them!! They are efficient & will load & unload your luggage if you are staying is Isla too, as we did.

Ferry service to Cozumel. There are actually 3 ferry service companies that run between Playa del Carmen and Cozumel. They leave on the half hour and hour so it's easy to get a ride. It is less expensive to purchase a round trip ticket. The drawback is that you do have to ride back with the same company. We chose to ride round trip on the Ultramar because it was leaving the soonest. We were going to wait (there were 5 of us)because the ticket was more expensive than the other two companies, but they gave me a discount, so even ferry tickets are negotiable.The ticket booth gave us the return ferry schedule, so it made it easy for us to find a convenient time to return.Do take caution if you are planning to return late. The last boat can fill up and then you will have to wait until morning to return. One of the hotel workers told us it had happened to her the previous week.

Rude ticket sales women!!. Pros:Ferry is very punctualRuns every 30 min until 11:30pm There is an air conditioned waiting room close to the men's restroom.Cons:Only 2 of the ticket sales women were niceOne was especially rude and extremely unhelpfulIf you purchase your ticket beforehand, you must bring a printed voucher. They will not accept an email confirmation.No one in the ticket office will be nice enough to help you out here.

What great Fun, Adventure and Entertainment!. We decided to got to Cozumel for an afternoon for the fun of it. Though it is largely a series of cruise ship docks and anchorings it is beautiful and different in its own right. The plaza at both Playa Del Carmen and Cozumel near both docks are fun a worth a look. An easy cab ride to the terminal from locations in Playa Del Carmen. Take the UltraMar Ferry. Blue and yellow "and" big really easy to spot.The real story hear is the crazy fun of riding the ferry with all the locals and Mexican tourists sprinkled with a handful of international tourists.The breeze is always blowing it seems in Playa. Beautiful breeze actually. The large safe passenger ferry makes its way to Cozumel in about 45 minutes dock to dock.On this day we sat by the Port side of the ferry and we were sprayed by lovely warm seawater as we cruised through some waves. The boat gently rocked but never scary. Just perfect actually.I addition we had the fantastic entertainment. A reggae singer on the way over with people dancing including one crew and plenty of laughter and smiles.On the return cruise we had a four piece blues in Espanol band. What fun.In addition we had a Tupperware convention group on board. Probably gathered for a weekend sales and celebration event. These ladies rocked the trip. Laughter and singing is always good.Felt like we were miles away on some wonderful adventure. Certainly made our day and would not want to have missed that adventure in our three week visit to Playa Del Carmen and our lovely unique stay in the “singular” Petit Lafitte Boutique Hotel.

Chaos!. They do not not card payments even though they advertise that they do, the lady that sells the tickets was running late and none of the other staff members know how to sell them. So by the time she got here 20 minutes after the ferry was scheduled to leave there was 50 people at least in a line trying to all buy tickets at once. They also charge an extra $3 US than there advertised price for no apparent reason.

Rough water, smelly boat. The ride to Cozumel was rough. The whole boat smelled like bathroom cake and I had to close my eyes or I thought I would puke from the choppy ride. I have never been sea sick in my life, but this was a tough 15-20 minutes to handle... I know it isnt really the boat's fault. There was a band playing music on the outer deck which was pretty good and fun, but the smell coming from the bathrooms and encompassing the entire inside the boat was just horrific...

Ok, but no other options that we knew about. These folks were late both ways. On the way over 45 min and on the way back about 1 hour. Save your money to rent a golf cart when you to your destination. Try to sell you cheezy photos you have to pose for before boarding.

Fast Ferry to Cozumel, and great entertainment.. We were in the UltraMar Ferry to Cozumel. I bought the online tickets from their website for traveling from mainland to Cozumel. But you also can buy it at the port as well, no need to buy it online. It took about 30 mins to reach Cozumel Island. On the ferry, there was a small performance of live band. Would love to recommend this ferry company.

Always a smooth quick ride. I've ridden the Ultramar Ferry many times from Cancun to Isla Mujeres I have always had a great ride this year in April we went to Cozumel flew into Cancun took the Ultramar ferry from Playa de Carmen to Cozumel even though it was pretty rough that day was still a great ride they help with your bags actually took them just like they would have if they are on an airplane so that you don't get the wrong one or somebody doesn't walk off with yours there's always music... snacks and if it's hot out ... air conditioned inside I believe there are two or three different ferry that you can take after taking a couple I like the UltraMar the best I believe they're all about the price I would use ultramar.....

Great Ferry. We bought our tickets before we left online and had absolutely no trouble getting a ferry voucher. Grab a beer or soft drink before you get on the ferry, sit upstairs, and enjoy the ride. Tons of seats, nice people, beautiful ocean, and always on time. On the returning ferry and guitarist played the time away...highlighly recommend!

Nice Ferry Ride. We took the Ferry to Cozumel, costing 300 pesos each round trip. The ride was very nice, the ferry was clean and the crew were fun. They offered snacks and drinks for the ride and even had a band for entertainment. It was very enjoyable

Quick, fun good schedule plus onboard entertainment!. Ferries from Playa del Carmen run everyday and quite frequently, you have many options to choose from. We took UltraMar (the blue and yellow boats). We paid 300 pesos round trip and boarded the next departing boat. It takes about 45 minutes dock to dock and we had onboard live entertainment, a 4 pc band doing covers and getting the passengers into the music on the way to Cozumel and a singer on the return trip.If you are prone to motion sickness go topside and sit in the middle to middle aft (less rolling and pitching) so you can keep the horizon in view. Avoid the side seats unless you don't mind a salt shower if the water is rough. Very enjoyable and professional staff.

Wish I had researched this part more. With all the research I did for my first trip to Mexico I neglected to read more detail about the part where I took the ferry from Playa Del Carmen to Cozumel. Our airport transfer driver basically brought us to the ticket booth for UltraMar - I just didn't realize there were multiple ferry companies. Don't get me wrong, I was fine with the ferry ride, just wish I knew a few things. One - it is not great to buy your return ticket ahead of time because then you are stuck with that specific ferry boat unless you want to pay for new tickets. When we returned we had just missed the 11 a.m. ferry and had to wait until 12:30 for the next boat. There were other ferries leaving at 11:30 and 12 that we could have taken if we did not already have tickets. This would have been okay if we didn't have all of our luggage with us. The boat ride was enjoyable - we sat on the top deck and enjoyed the sunshine. We were not expecting the entertainment. On our trip over it was a trio of musicians and they performed some fun songs - a few from my zumba class so that was fun, but they wanted tips at the end and I didn't like feeling like I needed to pay additional money for the entertainment that I was not expecting to have on the trip. On our return trip we were at least aware that it was going to happen so it was our choice to still sit on top even though there would be an entertainer. This time it was a solo male singer with a karaoke machine and it was just not very good. Bottom line - buy your ticket only when you are ready to go - there are multiple ferry boats at different times each day. UtraMar was a great ride, but know that there are singers on the top level. Unfortunately I don't know what the bottom part of the boat is like.

Pretty good, although.... I enjoyed the ferry ride - it's more expensive than other ferries to Isla Mujeres but overall is worth the extra. The boats feel well maintained and the staff feels more happy to be there. I took the ferry from Puerto Juarez instead of Playa Tortuga or any of the other Zona Hotelera beaches - Puerto Juarez is much cheaper comparatively for identical service. Carry pesos, the exchange rate will screw you if you let them - but that's as with anywhere else in Mexico. The one caveat - they say the lower deck is air conditioned: it is, but if you sit by the windows in the lower deck then you don't have the full effect of A/C. It may almost be worth it to trade off for an upper deck seat.

Isla mujares and Isla contoy. The ferry ride was nice food was good in Isla contoy . But the waiting time before the ferry ride from cancun can be cut short so we can get more time in Isla mujares . In Isla mujares we only got one hour . That was the only thing . Overall the trip was good

Nice, comfortable transportation...with entertainment!?!. Just a couple of points to make about this service. My wife and I used the one in Playa del Carmen to visit Cozumel. There are a couple different ferry companies, but I just liked the color of the boat, and that's how I made my decision. The ferry is located near 5th & Juarez in Playa del Carmen, and as you walk through the park/town square, there are a ton of vendors. There is also a restaurant, I think it is called Mexico Loco, but it is just past the ADO bus station and start walking toward the beach on the left. It had really good 'lemonade', in Mexico lemonade is actually limeade, but it hit the spot on a humid day. If you linger in the park area, you will get bombarded by little kids trying to sell their trinkets. It is sad to see, but once we told them, 'No thank you' (Or, "No, Gracias" in spanish), they walked away. As we got closer to the ferry, we had people asking if we were taking the ferry, and my mistake was that I started talking to someone before getting to the Ultramar booth. I got to the booth and purchased our tickets, I did one way because I wasn't sure what time we would head back, incase Ultramar didn't have the time we needed to leave. You don't save any money by purchasing round-trip, it is the same cost. After getting our tickets, the guy I talked to before the booth, was still standing there wanting me to 'help' me plan activities like renting a scooter while in Cozumel. Don't fall for this, there are other people on the other side that will actually have the equipment, I handed him my change in pesos and walked away so he would leave me alone.On the boat, you can sit on a bench outside or go in the inside where it is crisply air-conditioned. On the way to Cozumel we sat outside on the covered area, it was a nice ride, then we got entertained by a singer with huge speaker, looking for money. He was pretty good, but it was a little annoying that the company and employees allowed this, as some of us don't want to sit and listen to music we don't know, especially that it was blaring. My only other comment is that they have drinks and snacks on board that are pretty cheap compared to other places. I paid in pesos, which is typically cheaper than paying in US Dollars.

Nice way to get to Isla Mujeres. Quick trip to get to Isla Mujeres. Price is very reasonable and has plenty of seating inside and out. Runs every half hour so you can spend as much or as little time as you want on the island.

Fast and Fun. I have ridden the ferry several time from Cancum to Isle Mujeres. They leave about every half and hour during the day. It cost 10 Dollars round trip for each person. They load you up quickly and get you off even faster. Today, we had a musician playing on the top deck for our entertainment and tips. They have clean restroom in the port and also on the boat. The boat also have beverages for sale. Just a fun way to spend sometime and then walk around Isla Mujures.

Quick transport to Isla Mujeres. The Ultramar ferry is a quick way to get from Cancun to Isla Mujeres or to Cozumel. They have service from a number of ports in the hotel zone. There is usually a mariachi performing on the outdoor deck which is nice for first time riders but can grow old fast for returning visitors and locals. Have some pesos for tip ready!

Cheap, Regular & Quick. Took the ferry over to Cozumel mainly to get a present for my daughter from the island but found it to be quick, reliable and relatively cheap return at £12 return in Pesos.
There is plenty of room even when busy and the lower deck has a/c.
All in all a good experience

Clean Enjoyable ride. Recently my wife and I traveled to Cozumel by way of the Ultramar Ferry. Surprised at the cleanliness and efficiently run operation. The ride was smooth and only 35 minutes for 165.00 pesos one way. 300.00 if you prefer to take their round trip. They serve beers and mixed drinks while on the voyage.

An ideal transport for convenience and speed. An ideal transport for convenience and speed, very spacious, with an outdoor area where you can enjoy the view while traveling or if you prefer an enclosed air-conditioned area.

Your getting what you pay for.. The ferry the Isla Mujeres from Carasol terminal is affordable, about $19 usd. It's also quite fast for a boat of its size. The crew are pleasant and the vessel was obviously sea worthy. The draw backs are that the lower cabin is stuffy and un-comfortable even with a/c going. Also the ticket staff over charge you for a golf cart rental on the oldest most poorly maintained carts of the island. Don't take their suggested deals. Better yet, take the R1 bus Puerto Juarez and take the good ferry. It's cheaper, faster and more spacious.

Dont go to Isla Mujeres on the UltraMar Ferry. I went to Isla today, and the ferrys are not running often enough. It took us almost 2 1/2 hours to get on the ferry in Cancun at Puerto Juarez, and we had to wait for the third ferry to return us to Puerto Juarez. If you want to spend almost 4 to 5 hours waiting for a ferry to visit the Island, that is your choice, but not mine. Don't know what is up, perhaps a budget cut.

Fast and furious Ferry boats.... There are 2 different companies for Ferry, the price different is 8$/pp vs 9$/pp, you pick one...it goes fast...recommended to take sea sick pill if you think you will be sea sick...First floor inside is AC freezing cold...

Perfect. Perfect way to expore a beautiful country.. wish I had takem more ferries whilst I was in mexico.. From arriving at the port to buying tickets, waiting for the ferry and whilst on board. The whole experience was faultless!

ferry trip. well worth the 20$ just to get out on the gorgeous water. Enthusiastic local entertainment-be sure and tip. Great inexpensive outing to explore the island and see something different than crazy cancun. The dock at playa de tortuga had bungee jumping over the ocean(40$), surprisingly good food, souvenir shopping and a festive atmosphere.

Perfect way to get to Isla Mujeres. The husband and I wanted to visit Isla Mujeres and UltraMar Ferry was recommended. It was a quick and efficient trip... don't expect anything more than just a boat ride to the island. It was $4 one way and easy to reserve, however, they could not find our reservation regardless of the email we showed them. Our email had our confirmation number and proof of purchase. After a while and wait, they finally gave us our tickets. The window seats as expected were seated fast. The water is very beautiful to look at riding on the ferry from Cancun to Isla Mujeres, however, the window gets washed away by ocean water.

A relaxing start and end to our vacation in Cozumel. One way tickets were $10 USD each and ferry was clean, comfortable, large. Places to sit indoors, in A/C, or outside on metal benches (covered on top). Snacks and drinks, including beer, available on board. We had our luggage with us and were instructed to drop it off in one area and the porters would load it onto the ferry. They give you luggage claim slips so don’t lose yours. 30 min trip to Cozumel. Sit outside and scan the sea for flying fish! I really enjoyed just watching the blue colors of the ocean and feeling the warm sunny breeze on my skin – it helped put me in a relaxing mood for the start of my vacation. When we arrived at the Coz ferry dock, the porters loaded the suitcases onto a baggage cart and transported it 50 ft away onto an oval conveyor belt in a “secured” area. This took longer than it did to get all the people off the ferry. We pulled our bags off the conveyor belt and had our luggage slips ready to show the security personnel at the exit of the secure area. It will go faster if you have a few dollars in your hand along with your luggage slips. On the way back a few days later, we also dropped our luggage off with the porters and gave them a few $ tip, then retrieved it at PDC where they just put the bags out behind a tension barrier and you pointed to your bags (with $ in your hand) and they handed you your bags. This was faster than the conveyor belt that they used the first time. Either way, the key is to always have a few USD in your hand when you ask for something. There was a band on board in the upper deck/outside area and they played live music while we rode across to PDC. They also came around with a tip jar and were selling CD’s. They were not bad at all and they sang alternating songs in Spanish and English. Again, snacks and drinks were being sold as soon as the ferry left the dock. I find the ferry to be a pleasant experience, and UltraMar has very nice ships.

Live music whilst enjoying the crossing. Ultramar is a standard ferry which plies the Cozumel to Playa crossing. 30 min approx gets you across. On this occasion there was live music to keep the passengers entertained. Food and drink can also be purchased. Seating is both inside and outside - outside under cover and in full sun.

Quick and Efficient. $19 round trip per person from Cancun to Isla Mujeres. The ticketing process and boarding process was fast and efficient. The ride to the island was smooth and took no more than 20 minutes. The boat seemed well maintained, had bathroom facilities, indoor and outdoor seating. At the end of the day be sure to queue up early as the ferry terminal can get quite busy with everyone trying to leave the island.

Just ok. The boat seemed a bit run down. Easy to purchase tickets. Nothing special. Went to Isla Majeres island. Had no problems going. Returning the boat was 37 minutes late. That's too long to wait in the hot sun. They also had no one to explain to us why is was so late. Just so so. Take smaller type boat if possible. We paid $19 us per person.

Nicer than I expected. We took the ferry one day to Isla Mujeres. The seats on the ferry are basically what you ride on when you take a charter bus, very comfortable. The ride was very smooth. Two gentlemen walked around with papers to rent a golf cart on the island. It was only $35.00 USD for the day. You really cant beat that. The golf cart we had was pretty beat up but, for $35.00, I wasn't surprised. I will definitely be taking the ferry again when I return to Cancun.

Across to Playa del Carmen. We boarded the ferry and it left promptly as scheduled. The trip across the water was quick (20 minutes) and the waves were of no real concern until we docked at the pier in Playa del Carmen. The water was anything but calm on that side. The dock staff secured the ferry effortlessly and assisted every single person from the rocking boat. The return trip home left on time as well, but the waves were gigantic this time ! The captain maneuvered the ferry really well through the 30' swells and we docked safely back in Cozumel, although it did take about 45 minutes through those waves.

Purchase Tikcet either online on at place!. Getting a Ticket for $9.00 was a bargain to to go Playa Del CarmenLoved that they come and go every 30 mts I believeThis Ferry was very convenient and the agents were very pleasant!

It's a Boat Ride!. During a recent visit to Playa Del Carmen my wife and I took the UltraMar ferry to Cozumel. This is a boat ride folks, not a cruise ship! If you're prone to motion sickness don't spoil your trip by failing to take an appropriate dose of motion sickness medication. This will be a ride with a lot of motion even under the best of weather conditions, and will take between 30 and 45 minutes depending on wave conditions.

NICE FERRY RIDE TP COZUMEL. We took the ferry from playa del Carmen to Cozumel . It's approx. 25 mins across . If you have never been on one before , take gravol . It helps take the queezy feeling away . Actually I found sitting downstairs a lot more comfortable . It's air conditioned and has a big screen tv , and padded seats. They do sell snacks and drinks as well .

Took the UltraMar ferry to Cozumel on 03/17/2016 for $10.00 US/each. I picked this ferry because the female employees at the ticket office looked professional and there was nobody in line.I thought the Ferry ride was fun but it was a windy day and many looked sea-sick.The seating area on top was full and my wife was disappointed we couldn't sit there. After we got started and hit the waves the sea started to splash on top and the people came running down to the inside/air conditioned seating.The boat rock and rolled but I thought is was fun and enjoyed the trip over to Cozumel. Be prepared to wave off the peddlers, they can be very over-whelming. Just buy a one-way ticket to prevent losing or a problem with the return ticket.
Great ride to Isla Mujeres. So what can I say about this...it is a FERRY!!! We took it over to Isla Mujeres for the day. Nice, comfortable, scenic.

Visit Isla Mujeras by Ultramar Ferry. Just on the horizon off the coast of Cancun lie a unique Island where you can have a great day out, Using the ferry from alongside Riu Peninsular it only takes 25 minutes to reach the Island during which they offer to sell you tickets for golf carts on the Island which is the best way to get around. You will find that on reaching the Island there are dozens of places to hire these carts so you do not need to buy tickets on board the ferry. Once you arrive and hire a cart you set off on the circular road that circumnavigates the small Island and takes in sightseeing activities such as the turtle farm, well worth a stop, and the Punta Sur which gives fantastic views over the wild ocean and huge surfing style waves. We had great fun on the carts and they are really easy to drive if you can stop laughing long enough. There are loads of places to stop and take in the views and I definitely recommend it for anyone visiting the hotel resorts in Cancun.

Ultramar ferry- don't book rental car through them. We took the ferry round trip from Playa to Cozumel for the day. The ferry experience was fine- it was a 30 minute trip and the ferry was clean and comfortable. However, I made the mistake of booking a Jeep rental through Ultramar (they will offer you car rental, scooter rental, excursions, etc. when you buy your ferry tickets). The company they use is called Rooster's and it's terrible. The Jeep we got was missing the front passenger seat belt, the radio was broken, the check engine light was on, and the lone windshield wiper was broken (which became highly problematic when we got caught on the road in a late afternoon downpour). Book the ferry, but do yourself a favor and book a rental car directly through Avis or one of the established international rental companies on Cozumel.

Ferry ride from H--L. Carnival put us on this Ferry from Cozumel to Playa Del Carmen for a tour. It was early am on 2/26. This boat was too small for the seas it navigated. A storm had just moved through, there was a high wind and probably 10 ft swells. I grew up on the water and this was one of a handful of times I was afraid on the water. The crew, who speaks no English, sheparded us to the top. No choice for downstairs given. We were soaked 2 minutes into. The crew was laughing. They keep moving people from right to left- obviously not a good thing to do in high seas because you are overweighing one side of the boat.There was room for everyone downstairs and NO ONE should have been on top. People were sick everywhere. I was just afraid. This is how ferries capsize. We wound up moving to ENCLOSED downstairs 10 minutes into the hour long trip- which was WAY TOO dangerous. It is only a matter of time before this one winds up in the news. Do yourself a favor- pay a little extra money and/or go a little further and get on a bigger boat.

Ripped Off. We purchased round trip tickets in Playa del Carmen. When we tried to board worth the tickets in Cozumel, we were told a piece of the ticket was missing. Despite showing the ticket agent my bank account showing I purchased the tickets, we were forced to buy tickets again. Very bad customer service! We had proof of purchase, we should not have had to buy tickets again.

Great. Took the ferry from Coz to Playa. It runs hourly; another company runs on the half hour. Had no problem crossing on a very windy day. The ferries are clean and modern. Don't buy round trip if you're not sure what time you will be leaving, that is if you want to leave on a half hour and have bought a trip for the one that leaves on the hour, you'll have to wait around.We paid $10 ea one way. Last ferry leave 11 pm.I was freezing so I went upstair, much warmer.
Fun ride. An inexpensive and quick trip to the island! Always entertainment in good weather,and just a fun ride on the ocean.

The View Is Worth It. The best way to enjoy the colors of the sea, the water is always showing different shades of blue, sometimes you are able to see big fishes, corals or rayas, the air is always refreshing the Caribbean hot weather of the middle of the day, great transportation to Cozumel.
Good service. Nice ride from playa Del Carmen to Cozumel. Live entertainment on your way to the island nice crew and friendly. Cheap way to travel. Will use this service again!!

Great and Quick Ferry Service to Cozumel. This is a great ferry service with many options each day. Their is a variety of seating options both inside and outside. The ferries run on time and the trip takes about 30 minutes.I would use them again.

Easy to use. The tickets are easy to purchase before you get on. Bathrooms are clean on ferry but NOT at pier before you get on. Use the ones on the ferry if needed. It travels on a bit of Mexican time but overall clean and good experience. Take a Dramamine if you are prone to sea sickness and the upstairs open air helps.

Round trip not honored . 1. Cash only 2. Don't buy any "packages" ( golf cart, scuba etc) . There's plenty of carts and hasslers at the island when you arrive . At least you can see what you get before you buy...3. They DID NOT return us to original port as promised in brochure. Purchased round trip ticket and basically shrugged their shoulders as they winked at their taxi buddies. The taxis and ferries are obviously "contracted" with each other. We took the bus back to our hotel 7 miles away for 1/10 of the price ..adios jerks ..

Safe Ferry nothing to worry about. Ferry takes from point a to point b nothing to worry about. for some reason they only take cash. They have some silly practices like taking your luggage from the boat to "baggage claim carousel" 30 ft away, but not a big deal. Take your time, don't buy anything on the dock, not even a taxi. It will be much cheaper just feet away.

Great ride!. Ferry ride was great, fast and reasonably priced. However, their booking system for reserving a golf cart on Isla Mujeres needs to be improved. We booked and paid for a golf cart but when we arrived on Isla Mujeres, there were no more golf carts available. They need better communication.

Nothing too exciting to report.. Just a ferry over to Isla Mujures. $19 us per person takes about 25 min. The bar in the staging area on Playa Tortogas beach where you stand and wait for the ferry is VERY expensive and will try to overcharge you. I would avoid it.

Enjoy the trip. We took ULTRAMAR ferry from playa del carmen to cozumel.the price was 163 peso for one way and 300 peso for round (go and back).The trip took 40 minutes, nice music (some guys playes guitar and singing) the luggage arrived fast and didnt brake. Stuff was very nice. Recommended.

Ferry. We were flying into Cancun to stay in Isla Mujeres, so we took the ferry to the island. I thought riding on the upper deck was a blast! The view is the beautiful, the ride is fun, and I loved the guys playing guitar. I was smiling the whole time, both trips. Great way to start and finish a vacation.Seems like it's crowded heading to Isla Mujeres during the day and crowded heading towards Cancun in the evening. We did the opposite and there was a lot of open space.

Terrible travel advice. There's UltraMar Ferry ticket center near Gran Porto Retort, in front of the beach and Punta Langosta. A guy named Wil approached us on the fist day of our trip to Playa del Carmen. He sold us the around trip UltaMar tickets of $20 USD/person and $50 USD/person for Eco Tour Snorkeling all-inclusive with lunch and drink in Cozumel Island which the ferry would left in half hour. Wil said it's only took 15mins walking. However, it took half hour for us-first time visitor walking in the beach. We gave up and came back to reschedule for 10AM next day morning. We came to the information center again to check with the tour around 8:50am. The staff in the information booth said everything is ready for you guys, but the trip not including lunch. We were very surprised but since we paid already we still made our trip. That was not end of our surprises yet. Weather was good in Playa del Carmen but too windy in Cozumel. The ferry was really turbulent due to choppy waves and high speeds! After we landed, the snorkeling was closed in Cozumel due to windy and cold! We were very angry! We just checked before we left. The staff that told us everything was good to go in the morning apparently didn't call the tour guides at Cozumel, and did not inform us not to go because of the cancellation. We waited another 2 hrs for the return ferry since we did not plan to shop or do any other activities and we did not bring enough money and cloth....The guy Wil told us $18 only is for child, and $20 for adult...He took $2 per person into his pocket because the ferry ticket is $10 for child; $18 for adult.... And it's even worse to get refund! It took a day and half just to get refund for the snorkeling trip.... Wil and his staff were not trustworthy!! ... You really need them to write down everything into your receipt including Lunch; manager name and phone...

Fast service to Isla Mujeres. We boarded the Ferry at Playa Caracol, very close to our hotel. This port charges $22usd as opposed to the advertised $19USd. There is a $3 port fee? Must go in their pockets.Service to Isla Mujeres was fast but we were never told that there is a stop at another port along the way so the 30 minute trip ended up taking 45.On the way back, we were told that the ocean was too wavy to stop at Playa Caracol so they left us at another port. No offer of ground transportation to make up for this so we took the city bus (very inexpensive) back to our hotel. Bring water for the trip as they do not sell anything on this ferry as they do the other larger ones such as Playa del Carmen to Cozumel. All in all, a bit of a wasted trip as Isla Mujeres' beaches are really ugly and the town is dirty with few attractions. DOn't waste your time.

Best Option to get to Isla Mujeres. We took the ferry from Cancun (Port Juarez) to Isla Mujeres. It was a little over $160 pesos per person, and the ferry departs every 30 minutes and runs all day! The ferry itself was very clean and in good condition. There is an interior seating area with large windows, and an open air top deck. I loved sitting up top! The views were fantastic and it was fun to feel the sea spray. The ride itself took about 20 minutes, but there were some high winds the day we sailed.

Fast and fun. We took this ferry from Cancun to Isla Mujeres. They run every half hour so it is very convenient and about 160 pesos per person one way. The boat has a top deck open to the sun and a lower enclosed deck for bad weather. The staff help you aboard and stow you luggage for the trip- very friendly and helpful. The trip was quite enjoyable with good views leaving Cancun and approaching Isla.

Easy, Convenient, Fun. There are three ferry companies offering transportation every hour between Playa Del Carmen and Cancun. (Services are staggered). You can purchase tickets before your go out on the dock to board the boat. Prices for a ONE way ticket range from $9.00 to $11.00 depending on which ferry company you choose. UltraMar was $9.00.Three recommendations are-1-Go earlier in the day on weekends or peak season to avoid the crowds. 2-Only purchasing a ONE way ticket so that on your return you will only have to wait something less than 30 minutes for a ferry ride back on this or the other two ferry services. If you purchase a round trip ticket you might save a couple of dollars but it will cost you in time. 3- In order to get a decent seat, go ahead and get in line on the dock.I took the UltraMar ferry on the way over to Cancun and one of the competitors on the way back. UltraMar was less expensive, a better experience with entertainment, beverage servers and more outside seating. I would recommend this service. The bright yellow and blue boats.

Fastest way to get from Cancun to Isla Mujeres. Round trip fast Ferry is only $19 per person. They took cute picture on the dock as you board and amazingly found everyone on return trip to sell the pic for $10 - well worth it. You can take slower car ferry which docks outside of town in Isla Mujeres but not us.

Ferry to Cozumel. We took the ferry to Cozumel. i think it was 165$ pesos per person on way. they suggest to buy one way at the time because sometimes they refuse the return ticket and you end up having to buy another one. once you get to Cozumel there is so much you can do. We rented a Jeep and rode around the island

Nice boat, but expect sales offers. This boat had a mini bar right inside the front door that had beer and also frozen mixed drinks, which was nice.. except that I had a pretty choppy ride and ended up regretting the pina colada.Was approached for on-island rental sales for scooters, etc. Polite but we declined. Boat was very clean and new, plush inside and a very entertaining band on the upper deck. Would go again.

Fast and easy . Ferry was pretty easy to find. From the hotel district hop on a city bus and take it to the playa tortuga stop. Round trip tickets are around $19 for 2 people. You can also pre-order your golf cart here as well and pay by credit card. You MUST have a driver's license or you'll have to put a $50 USD deposit when you get to the golf cart place. The guy at the ticket booth will tell you otherwise but I found this out first hand. Ferris run every hour with the last one from the Isla Mujeres coming back around 5pm.

Very comfortable and relaxing.. I had been hesitant for years (10) about going over to Playa del Carmen by ferry due to reviews of people getting sick. Took the chance with my two teenage children and hubby this past summer and glad we did it. Ferry was air conditioned, has comfy big seats, drinks, snacks, restrooms, lots of room inside and outside for seating. Family even slept on the way back to Cozumel. Don't wait like I did, take the ferry and explore.
Very good service to Coz…..fast and clean. The boats are fast and clean. Has a bar with snacks. The ac works great so its nice and cool inside the cab. The staff professional. Would use again.
Ferry from Cozumel to Playa Del Carmen . We took the Ferry back and forth to Cozumel / airport. The ride was very quick 30 minutes and staff was nice. They offer refreshments during the trip.

They made us miss our ferry and wait 1 hour in order to sell us a tour. A lady from UltraMar approached us when we were queuing to tell us about a snorkel trip they were selling. We said we didn´t have time because the ferry was leaving in 5 minutes. She said "don´t worry, there is still time". We went with her to the nearby UltraMar office where she spent 15 minutes trying to charge my mastercard using up to 4 different machines. None of them was working so I told them we were leaving. She insisted and called her manager who tried a couple more times until it finally worked. FINALLY THEY HAD THEIR MONEY! THey were both very relieved. In the meantime, THE FERRY HAD LEFT WITHOUT US AND WE HAD TO WAIT AN HOUR until the next ferry departed to Cozumel. But that is not the end of it. When we reached the Aqua Safari pier in Cozumel, THE SNORKEL TRIP HAD LEFT WITHOUT US, even when we were assured that "they will be waiting for you in Cozumel". We had to wait another TWO AND A HALF hours until the next snorkel trip departed, and as you can guess, it was probably one of the worst snorkel trips we´ve had, including crappy equipment and rude manners from the staff, who was only worried about their tips. The operator was Aqua Safari for your information.Avoid purchasing anything from the Ultra Mar staff at the Cozumel pier. Everything can be arranged much cheaper at any of the beaches in Cozumel (snorkel, diving, jetski..) and those operators are far more professional and polite.

HORRIBLE. I inquired after the ferry from Playa del Carmen to Cozumel, and was told that there would be a ferry at my port at 9 o'clock in the morning. I arrived the next day to discover that The 9 o'clock was at another port, approx. 1 mile away, and the next ferry at my port was at 9:45. We decided to wait for this instead of running to the other port. We waited 45 minutes only to discover at our inquiry, 5 minutes to go, that our port had been cancelled and we would have to go to the other port 1 mile away. The misinformation was their fault, they claimed that they had called the other ferry to wait for us, and we had to run all the way to the other port as they provided no taxi. We arrived only to discover that the ship had left. Sweaty, exhausted, and awful, we demanded compensation from them for wasting our whole morning and also causing us to miss our tour we had booked in Cozumel. The staff was extremely unfriendly and cold, and gave us absolutely NOTHING for their mistake. Instead they merely took our tickets and refunded us, telling us to go to another company. PLEASE DO NOT PATRONIZE THIS HORRIBLE COMPANY.

Fast, easy and entertaining. Easy and fast transportation from Playa del Carmen to Cozumel. The ride was smooth and the day was gorgeous so no complaints. For our listening pleasure there was even a singer on board with his makeshift P/A system belting out the latest pop hits. (If you take in a beer or two it'll all be very entertaining.)

Just mediocre. The first day we tried to get to Isla Mujeres, we popped out of the hotel, and in typical Mexican fashion, a concierge sort, definitely not an employee of the Riu, put us in a cab that went maybe 8 blocks for 15 bucks, I knew then that we had just been had. The terminal was like a little craft fair clip joint, and the lady in the booth, wanted 3 times the rate I had read. I seldom get miffed, but suggested, she was goosing us just a bit too much, and we walked off. The frugal wife wanted to bus it back to the Riu but a little old cabbie pulled up, and asked where we were going. I told him, I didn't find a closed automotive shop and a tire store, very interesting, so he took us back to the hotel for 10 bucks, and due to the one way set ups, had to go maybe 40 blocks. I got up the next morning, and noticed the ferry docking 200 feet down the beach. Long story short, we walked 200 feet on the sand, had a couple of beer, and went to Isla Mujeres. I would compare riding around the Isla comparable to the Road to Hana, on Maui. I wouldn't call it a waste of time, but it used the better part of one day, out of our 7. The departure time on our return didn't suit us, so we took the first boat, to the downtown terminal, which is a good place to depart, other than our original departure dock, earlier that day, next to the hotel. I still wonder why the guy outside the hotel sent us on a bum steer the first day, other than the cab driver pieces off concierge guy, and the lady in the booth is in cahoots with the cab driver. Welcome to Mexico. If you feel you are being had, just don't do it. We had an inexpensive lesson. This post is under the ferry, not so much the Isla. To be clear, the ferry was very professional, it was just the rest of the day, was not so hot

Modern Experience. There are three ferries that cross from Playa Del Carmen to Cozumel. Ultramar is the most expensive for tourists but not by much. Currently the charge 163 pesos... (about $10 US). The two others, Caribe and Mexico III charge 138 or so pesos. Ultramar seems to be the fastest... by a few minutes. The boat is modern, clean and as nice as any ferry I've been on (and I've ridden on ferries in Vancouver, Seattle, L.A. and Key West). The typical person will walk up to the three counters and look at the posted times for when the next ferry leaves... and pick the earliest one. Usually you only need to buy one way and then buy your return ticket when you are coming back... again usually from the one leaving the soonest.

Quick, Fast and Clean. I only ended up on the Ultra Mar ferry because they were the next to be leaving the docks at Playa Del Carmen. The boat was very large and wasn't near full either time I was on it (two different ships). Both ships were very clean and the crew was friendly and not pushy about the food they were trying to sell. The ferry to Cozumel left a few minutes early, while the ferry back left right on time. Very fast trip both times (35 minutes).

Fun and Fast ride to Isla Mujeres. Boats have an air conditioned cabin as well as an open air seating area on top. We had live music with a classical guitar player on the way out to the island and that was really festive. They do encourage you to tip and I was more than happy to do so. You can get the ferry from the Hotel Zone for $19, but they also operate out of Puerto Juarez for 164 Pesos (about $10) and you can reach that on the R1 bus. You may have to wait a little longer for the bus back to the Hotel Zone from Puerto Juarez but I'm a sucker for paying local prices. Simple but nice ferry service that will get you to Isla Mujeres every half hour.

Horrible Customer Experience. I lost a portion of my ticket and didn't realize it until we were boarding the ferry. My friends and I were trying to get on this ferry to catch the last shuttle back to our resort. It was apparent that my two friends and I purchased our tickets together given the sequence of numbers. Guy in photo did not offer any flexibility for us to board the ferry. His attitude was such a spoiler. Tip would be don't lose your ticket and evened the an innocent instance, they won't bend. Other than that transportation is reliable and uneventful. One star rating is based on the customer experience which can make or break the experience.

Comfortable and Reliable Ferry!. My husband and I took the Ultramar ferry to/from Playa Del Carmen/Cozumel. The ferry was on time for each ride and the ride was very comfortable and smooth. On our ferry back to PDC there was even live entertainment which was fabulous! I would highly recommend Ultramar for transportation to/from PDC/Cozumel!

Ferry to Isla Mujeres. Our group of four women took the ferry across from cancun to Isla mujeres. We left from puerto Juarez. The ferry left on time and was a pleasant ride. The restrooms at the landings were clean and neat. Snacks and beverage service was available. I felt safe and comfortable on this little adventure and we thoroughly enjoyed our little shopping spree on the island.

Playa to Cozumel. Took the ferry after a wedding in Puerto Morelos. If the weather is windy the boat may be rocking. It takes about 45 minutes and it cost gringos $10 each way. (Cash only)We had luggage so you do have to check it. Go toward the back of the boat and someone will give you a ticket for bags you check. We brought on a carry-on sized bag with underwater camera equipment-we sat on top where there is more room and more air and less of a chance to get sea sick. Boats can be more crowded on the weekends. It's a nice inexpensive ride to Cozumel.

Ferry to Isla Mujeres. Take the ferry from Puerto Juarez, it’s about half the cost of catching it from the hotel zone. Take the R-1 bus from the hotel zone and it terminates at Puerto Juarez. There’s also a $3 usd port fee in addition to the price of the ticket, didn’t see that mentioned anywhere on the website.

Easy trip, but not so much on time :). Typically ferry ride but they had a live band that was really good and made the time pass quicker. Prices where about $18 per person round trip and ferry left every hour. Be sure to get a round-trip ticket as it's a little more expensive to get 2 one-way tickets. Ferry left about 10 minutes later than posted both times.

Nice trip to Cozumel. This is a very nice service and round trip to Cozumel island. We sail on Nov the 30th at 2 pm and then get back to Playa del Carmen in the evening.
Music was the same both ways. These musicians needs to add more songs to their playlist :)
Funny, nice, good price!!!

“El Embarcado”. We arrived to book our ferry tickets fro transport from Cancun to Isla Mujeres after checking with the concierge in the hotel to make sure the ferry was running. After we arrrived, they told us that the ferry was not running from that location but they would bus us to another location in which the ferry was running. We were planning on renting a golf cart on the island for the whole day. The guy who sold us our tickets told us that if we did not book it thought him, we would not be ableto get one. So, like the suckers we ended up bing, we did it. Do NOT do this. There are many available rides right across the street from the port and were less than the cost to rent from the ferry operator. Plus, we ended up having to walk several blocks to try and locate the building that we could get our golf cart from. When we got there, we found out that we only had until 5 PM with the golf cart. This was a problem since we were delayed several times through no fault of our own. Plus, the guy running the counter was rude and "could not understand english well."The bus that they arranged to transport us pulled up on the side of the road and told us to get out for the ferry. This was after we were delayed once more by the bus driver running a red ligth and getting pulled over. We had no idea where we were going and there was no one from the ferry service to help us. A nice gentleman on the sidewalk helped us. We ended up having to walk a couple of blocks and wait another 45 minutes for the next ferry.... all the more taking time away from our day there and the golf cart rental. The ferry was nice and well taken care of. The service was absolutely horrendeous!

Quick and clean. We sat both inside and outside on the deck, both were pleasant. Nice morning ride on the deck with a little local Sax. They play lots of 80s music. The ferry is always on time. Leaves ever thirty minutes. Buying round trips are cheaper. Our ferry was to Isla Mujeres that departed from Puerto Juarez.

Kill Two Birds With One Stone. For all you tourists who book a trip to Playa del Carmen or Cozumel Mexico I would strongly suggest you get a taste of the other location by using the UltraMar Ferry.The ferry is very clean and comfortable for the 45 minute journey between the two ports. The service is every two hours all day in both directions. I would recommend it most highly for a nice change of pace.

Fast way to Cozumel.. We have travelled to Cozumel by UltraMar ferry now for a couple of times. It is a ferry company, as the rest of them. Clean ,fast and good staff. If the seas are rough, all boats will pitch and you might get sea sick -this does not have anything to do with the company, like some here seem to think. So take a pill before you leave, and spend a nice 30 minutes out on the sea.
Its a ferry. Not sure what more to say, the boats are big, clean, well run, and on time - they get you to the off shore islands as promised and prices are fair.
Great idea!. We always go to Cozumel on our cruises and wanted something different. This time we took the ferry to Playa Del Carmen. Very cheap $13.50 per person and we got to see the mainland.

Embarcadero. The ultramar ferry sails from Puerto Juarez and a taxi from downtown Cancun cost approximately 3-4 dollars. The ride to Isla Mujeres takes less than thirty minutes and you can sit top side in the open air or inside below which is air conditioned. At the ticket terminal in addition to tickets they will try to rent you a golf cart or scooter to use to tour the island. You can make a better deal when you reach the island. Beware if you are not vigilant you make get shortchanged at the ticket counter. Overall it is a large improvement from the previous ferry service to Isla Mujeres.

Wasn't a Bad Way to Get to Cozumel. Rather than flying direct to Cozumel we decided to taxi to PDC from Cancun and ride the ferry. It was very affordable, right about $10 per person. Boats are nice, air conditioned, snacks and drinks available. Ocean was pretty rough on the way over and could be a problem if one is prone to seasickness

Nice ride to Isla Mujeres. We picked up the ferry at a dock just a couple of blocks from our hotel. The cost for the round trip was $22 round trip which seemed very reasonable. The boat was very clean and the staff was kind.The strange part of the trip was there was a man with a guitar playing and singing on the top deck. He sang two songs and then came around with a tip jar that he thrust in each persons face. The boat docks at a central location on Isla Mujeres. Make sure to note what number boat you got off of. There are 4 different boats that go to different drop off points. There are specific places to line up for each boat for the return trip.

Posted Departure Time Not Observed. Boarded the ferry and noted the posted departure time was to be 3pm. Sometime after 3pm one of the crew came in and announced we were leaving soon. Then another 15 mins passed and another announcement made. We didn't leave until about 40 mins past the posted departure time of 3pm. By then we had been sitting in the ferry nearly an hour bobbing up and down in the rough seas. Not real comfortable.

El Embarcado. Sold us our ferry tickets with our golf carts included. Arrived at the island and they sold us golf carts that were not available. Said our golf cart included insurance which I found out was not true when a scooter ran into us and we had to pay for the damages

boat ride to Cozumel. I took the ferry ride from Playa del Carmen to Cozumel. The ride was nice, and accomodations are adequate. The luggage was checked, and I got to ride in the shaded area. It is a neat ride.

Fast and Fun trip to Cozumel. We used Ferry between Playa Del Carmen and Cozumel! 35 minutes of fun! We used upper open deck, perfect for wonderful pictures! Inside very clean, has restroom, air conditioning, big screen tv's. Transfer was 240 pesos per person, kids under age of 5 are free!

Fast, reasonably comfortable. We were told this was the best way to get to Isla Mujeres, and it is fast and efficient, and runs often enough we didn't have to wait to return. The only downside was that the taxi driver in the cab line after didn't know where our resort was, and drove in the wrong direction over our protestations until he gave up. Be very careful getting back to your resort from the Ferry! You don't want a cab ride to spoil a very efficient ferry ride.

Fast, Safe and Comfortable!. We took the ferry over to Isla Mujeres from the RIU Palace Peninsula area for a relatively cheap round trip ticket. The ride was smooth, fast and included some live music during the ride. If you are looking for a quick way over (and back) to Isla Mujeres from Cancun then I recommend using the UltraMar Ferry.

Consistent, Safe, Comfortable. Always a great ferry ride to say the least! Always clean and affordable. The ferry times are listed online and in most resorts near the area. For $17 usd round trip you can leave early and stay in Cozumel most of the day! They offer beverages from soda, water to libations on your 30 minute ride to the island. Can't go wrong - they gotcha covered.

Trip to Cozumel. We used this service to travel between Playa Del Carmen and Cozumel on our honeymoon. Not the cheapest ferry, but the most convenient for sure. Nice boat, staff okay, overall satisfied and would use again.
Great experience . This was a great experience. It allowed us to go back and forth and really experience more of Mexico, and was extremely easy, clean & comfortable

Great stable fast ride. Nice to have ferry every 30 minutes. The location is a bit far from our hotel but not too bad. Price is a little expensive but they gave me a small discount when i asked and i bought the round trip ticket. Four people about 600 pesos round trip. Boat was fairly big - we did not ride the smaller ones. Very stable. We took Dramamine before trip to island Mujeres, but it was so stable we did not take it on return trip. If you go too early nothing will be open on the island, except the golf cart rental. We enjoyed driving with fee people on the road! DO NOT take the Ultramar taxi when you come back. They price gouge way more than other servivices!!

Clean, Fast, Easy way to Cozumel.. Ferry service from Playa Del Carmen to Cozumel. Clean, Fast, Friendly. Easy on and easy off (with luggage). Nice air-condition inside and beautiful outside seating. Very nice trip.

Fast and Efficient. We used the UltraMar Ferry twice to take us from Play del Carmen to Cozumel. You can choose to sit in comfort in the air conditioned section or sit in the open air section. We did both. There is usually a band playing on the open air section. Hearing the live music helps pass the time. The trip took us no longer than 45 minutes each way. Excellent customer service, too. If you are carrying bags, you'll need to check them. They use a numbered tag that matches a receipt they give you. Don't lose the receipt. UltrMar checks the number on the receipt to the number on the bag. You will not be allowed to take with your bags without the receipt. AND don't forget to Tip the Band!

Beware. Do Not use this company. THEY LIE!!! Sold me round trip tickets to Cozumel, saying the last ferry back to Playa del Carmen was at 9:00pm, the last shuttle was at 7:00 had to purchase new tickets with a different company. Be careful with the parking attached to the ferry ride, again they LIE
Quick trip to Playa del Carmen!!!. So smooth and easy. We walked up to the pier paid for our tickets 15 minutes before departure.The round trip ride was very comfortable with AC and a clean boat.
Best way to Cozumel!. Comfortable, fast, clean and safe...everything you want in a ferry ride! My son enjoyed watching the waves and didn't get seasick at all.

No complaints. A Great service! . My wife and I used this service during one of our excursions on our honeymoon. We took a regular ferry from Playa del Carmen to Cozumel. There was a live band on board and they were fantastic! I loved listening to them and if they had a show while we were in town, we probably would have gone! The way back was an express ferry. It was a nicer boat and was very comfortable. Enjoyed both rides.

Good and organized service. There are two major ferry services between Cozumel and Playa del Carmen. I tried both in one week. This is by far the better service. Upgraded ferry with excellent A/C and friendly staff. Far better seating as well. Definitely recommended.Oh and this is not an attraction, it is a service. But oh well, I guess if you had enough tequilas on board (yes they have a bar), it COULD be an attraction as well. :)

Great ferry service from Playa del Carmen and Cozumel. The boats are in good shape, have Wi-Fi service and snack and beverages are offered for purchase. The staff is attentive and efficient. The boats departed and arrived on time.

My favorite ferry line to take while in Cozumel!. We've always taken UltraMar Ferry lines while in Cozumel/Cancun/Playa Del Carmen and its always been a good experience.
