We planned to go to Playa (from Cozumel) on Sunday of our trip and pretty early in the morning. We got there around 8:15 and the next ferry was at 8:30 but with Mexico WaterJets company. We bought a round trip and went about our way. This was the first time we've taken this company but we did because it was the next trip out. The mistake here was that when we were ready to leave Playa we had just missed the ferry and the next one wasn't for another hour and a half. Therefor, we bought a one way with UltraMar so we could get back to Cozumel. I would always recommend getting one way tickets, no matter which ferry line for this. Anyways, UltraMar is always my favorite for multiple reasons but to name a few, they always have crew members walking around making sure everyone is okay and that everyone has a safe trip and they always leave on time. With the exception of one time, we've had entertainment on the boat which I love. It really gets people in the mood to have a good time. I know some people can get sea sick and many have complained about that on the reviews. I've been a handful of times and I've never felt sick even with high waves. I wouldn't criticize the ferry line for that as its a more as a individual thing. I think they are very safe and look out for all passengers. UltraMar would be by first choice when traveling by sea whether its to Playa, Cozumel, Cancun or Isla Murjeres. I've been to all and all sizes of boats.

Clean and cool!. We stayed in Cancun for a week and took the ferry from Tortugas 3 times. 2 times we returned on the 5:30 ferry, but one night we stayed later and took a different ferry. The ferries are really clean and air conditioned well inside or beautiful to sit up top in the fresh air.

Enjoyable ride but beware of overcharges. My wife and the kids have stayed in Playa the last three years. We decided to take a trip over to Cozumel this year to one of the private beach clubs. There are three companies that offer ferry services to and from Cozumel, UltraMar being one of them. The published schedule says departures are generally on the hour every hour however when we arrived to pay the schedule was for 11:30 and we probably actually left at 11:45. We were charged 586 pesos for 3 adults and 1 child. The lady at the booth said they did not take credit card which I later found out to be untrue. She told me it would be $44 USD. I did not think much about the conversion until I after I boarded that she have overcharged me about $8. Coming back I used a credit card, go figure, and it was the same cost but when I received my Capital One alert it was $36 USD. The lady basically pocketed $8.

Left us stranded. Did not go on schedule. Had to wait two hours to get across and another hour to get on a ferry to go back. I understand technical difficulties, but there was no communication. We were just left angry in the hot sun.

Good vibes to Cozumel!. The music onboard made the trip to and from Cozumel more enjoyable. I tipped the band. I even got a drink while aboard. We were up top to enjoy the band and fresh air; it made the short trip go even faster.

Prompt courteous service. We were happy with the people and the comfortable ride. The cabin was air conditioned. The ride took about 25 minutes and then when we went to return to Cancun at 4pm they let us on even though the gate was already closed (we were running behind)
Good. Took the boat across to Isla. It was a quick, fun & sometimes choppy way to travel to the Isla. For only $19 each, you cannot go wrong with some form of entertainment both ways.

Nice ride. We enjoy taking this ferry to Isla. It is clean, comfortable, and it has air conditioning inside. The attendants are great packing your luggage away, the topside is fun on a good day, and they have a guy playing a guitar and singing for your entertainment...just tip him...good company....
Fast ship to cozumel. The ferry ride to cozumel was fast, comfortable and entertaining. I believe we paid between $15-20 US per ticket. Overall i was happy with the service.

Fun but can be choppy . It's a 40 minute trip and on a clear day you can see from Cozumel over to playa - but be warned it can be very choppy so pick a good clear day - there are other ferries but we like this one because they have more outdoor seating and usually have live music onboard too - safe trip - just get your sea legs.

Quick and Easy ride to Cozumel. It was a quick and easy way to spend a day in Cozumel. It was a nice excursion and the ferry left every hour or so. Best to just get a one way ticket as there is more than one carrier and that way you can return on the next available ferry.

Great Transportation. We arrived with a man on a trike carrying our luggage and depositing it behind the security gates (for $50. I went over and got 2 one-way tickets to Cozumel for $163 MXN each. We used UltraMar because it was the ferry line running the soonest from Playa del Carmen to Cozumel and was the last one we could be on to meet the 16:00 deadline.UltraMar is the yellow and blue line. Their ferries have an open air deck, it was open when we went this trip, on Saturday afternoon November 1st so we sat on top with the blinds open, it was refreshing. There was live music and people selling snacks and drinks, including National beers.All together the ferry takes an hour; this includes loading, travel and unloading. They now tag your luggage when you check it in, giving you half the tag to claim it at the other side. You give them the tag, point out your bag, they verify the tag matches and give it to you. Do not lose the tags; it will cause a considerable hassle for you, especially if you do not speak Spanish. They have never told me there was a limit to the amount of luggage you can bring, we have hauled tons of luggage and groceries but that does not mean that there is not a limit that they enforce at high capacities.The ferry ride can be rough and often times it is. I have only had one smooth trip. If you tend to get car, motion or boat sickness you will want to take medication for it before crossing. I grew up on boats and never had a problem but there have been several times that the sea has gotten the ferry’s bow a rolling, especially in the lower deck, where it can sway and roll back and forth as you bump and ram wave after wave, and I myself could not wait to get onto steady land. For a more detailed account of our experiences with both UltraMar and Mexico WaterJets Ferry Lines check out Traveling Martinezes

Fast Service - Look for Life Jackets. It only takes about 30 minutes to go across Cozumel to Playacar, Playacar to Cozumel. Findout where the life jackets are because so one will tell you. If you want a window or outdoor seat get there at least 20 minutes before departure. $16 roundtrip.

Relaxing Ferry!. We have visited Cozumel a half dozen times and will always pick the yellow ultramar!! I know it costs a little more but it is faster and it more accommodating for luggage. I recommend sitting outside on the second deck. The live music always sets a perfect atmosphere!

Amazing Ride. This boat ride to Cozumel was so much fun. We sat on the top deck in the back and enjoyed the views and the light splash of mist from the waves. They have a live band that plays on the boat as well as selling alcohol, which is always a good thing. Highly recommend this ferry. It was $22 per person round trip.

Great Trip. The Ferry from Playa to Cozumel and Cozumel to Playa was fantastic. Great value and even had entertainment to and from! It was a very pleasant ride and great music! I would def reccommend taking the ferry even if it is just to sight see!! We did see a sea turtle and lots of fish to and from! If you want to sit on the deck or ride in the airconditioner this ferry has it all! You can even purchase cold drinks!
From Point A to Point B. It gets you where you're going. It's a little pricey so my suggestion is to plan to spend a day in Cozumel to make it worth your while.

Prompt, but puzzling. The ferry to and from Cozumel is prompt and on time. It's puzzling to understand the price. Street hawkers herd you to the ticket window. Our charge was $22 round trip. Of, course, they only take cash and, as typical in the area, the attendants conveniently don't have change. If you buy round trip, remember that your particular ferry company may not return exactly when it is convenient for you. Later in the day, the ferries return every two hours, instead of on the hour. Seas can be a bit rough on the short 40ish minute ride.
Efficient and Comfortable. The ferries run constantly between Cozumel and Play de Carmen. All boats are comfortable for the 45 minute trip. Boarding and I boarding is quick and easy.

You never know the price!. So what I quickly learned in Mexico is, the price is never the real price ! We had seen the price chart listed and once we got close to the ferry, men came up to us telling us that they could get us a deal. They said 22.00 US each and lead us over to pay, once there the ladies working there were yelling that the ferry was leaving and it was 30.00 US each! In a rush we paid the money. The confusion is there are price charts at hotels, at the warf etc... None of them give the same price. We were later told 30.00 US each return was a really good deal.I guess the only advice is don't be suprised that no one seems to know how muchit costs!!! Also if you want to sit up top for the view you will have to be ther early and wait in line. Also use the bathroom before you get on, one of the ladies in our group used the facilites and there was an inch of waste on the floor. she was told it was from the waves rocking the boat around. At the very least don't wear flip flops

BEWARE. I asked if they took credit cards and they said no. I asked again, "How can that be"? "Cash only Signore". I figured out why. A one way trip was $12 USD. I gave the rude attendant a $50 bill. She returned $20 pesos about $1.25. That's why they want money. On the return I paid with a credit card no problem, same boat crew and all. BTW the ferry is convenient but packed so get on early to get a seat. if not they'll put you in the engine room!! They really don't care as long as they get your money!!!

Great service . The best $10 usa you'll spend on vacation and that's round trip from Puerto Juarez more expensive from hotel zone and not as frequent. Awesome ride ,service, and Caribbean blues! Usually live entertainment also, classic mexican musicians. And best yet you get off on an island! Don't forget our vacation is to someone else's home, be a good tourist and you're going to have a better time!

Easy and inexpensive way to get to Cozumel!. Weather was windy and seas a bit rough but a fast and easy way to get to Cozumel to spend a day. Don't buy your return ticket until you're ready to leave so you won't have any time constraints.

Great ferry service. But don't book return ticket.. Great ferry service. But don't book return ticket. Clean ferry, clean bathrooms. If the water is rough, hope that you don't have a weak stomach. The reason they say not to book a return ticket, is that there are several ferry companies, and the one you are booking may not return till a later time of the day. That means you may have to wait an hour for your specific company to return instead of just booking another ferry company that is leaving sooner for the same price.

Great Views but Big Motion Sickness. We took the ferry from the port located next to the Barcelo Costa Cancun. It was pretty windy that day and there were some swells in the ocean. This caused the boat to rock side to side and from front to back. Made for a crazy ride. Even the caballero who was singing on the boat was holding on for dear life while his amp was falling over. On a calm day, this would be a great ride. The cost was $19 USD return pp.

Ultramar Ferry to Cozumel. Very enjoyable ferry ride from Playa del Carmen to Cozumel. 30-35 minutes. Boarding and exiting the ferry was very quick. Cost was $24 US for two people each way. For those of you who are worried about motion sickness, it was actually quite a smooth ride the day we went. Ultramar Ferry runs every hour.

Fun Ride. My first trip on ferry to Isla Mujeres. I road downstairs going and it was a bit rough. On return to Cancun, I rode on top. We had a guy singing Spanish songs for tips. The view was awesome. Nice outing for family or friends.

Go to Cozumel!. Very efficient and they have a band playing during the ride. On time. So easy to get to Cozumel and spend the day there. Don't go if you get seasick, however, without taking dramamine or wearing an ear patch. We went on a very windy day and I felt pretty queasy. No fun to listen to "La Bamba" while tossing your cookies.

Great trip to Isla Mujeres!. I was told that visiting Isla Mujeres is an absolute must when you are in Playa del Carmen (or Cancun)--so we made our way out there. First, we took the ADO from Playa del Carmen to Cancun, hopped on a taxi, and headed to the Ultramar Ferry dock. The ferries leave about every half hour, and are pretty on schedule.My friend and I purchased a flexible round trip ticket that could be used at any time. It was about $10 roundtrip. We boarded the boat rather quickly, and made sure to nab a seat on top.For entertainment, there's a guitar player who sings a mix of songs. I didn't feel sea sick at all and really enjoyed the boat ride. In a short 20 minutes, we arrived in Isla Mujeres!

Only by One Way Tickets - Gives More Flexibility for Your Return. We took the ferry from Playa to Cozumel and back again the same day. I would recommend purchasing only a one way ticket because there are two ferry companies with different times. I purchased round trip tickets so I had to wait around for an extra hour instead of being able to go on the other ferry. The tickets cost around $11 per person each way. Bring pesos or American dollars because they don't always accept credit cards. As others have stated there was a band playing which was very entertaining and helped to pass the time.

Speedy Service, Beautiful Jet Catamarans. I loved the rapid service to Isla Mujeres-the ride was really fun, the watercraft were amazing! The boats run every half hour, and you have your choice of riding on the top deck or below in the beautiful interior cabin with large view windows.

Nice trip. Nice ferry ride. Took about 30 min to get to Cozumel from Playa del Carmen. The downside was that Visa was not accepted. For a group of 8 we were taken back about this. Cost is $10 US each way. Comes often so times were not a problem.

Gliding all the way to Isla Mujeres!. Riding the Ultrmar to Isla Mujeres was such a treat! It was a beautiful day and we rode on the open aired top level. It was a 20 minute ride. There were two gentlemen up front singing and playing guitars and instruments. What a nice touch. The ocean was calm and we glided along. There is a lower level covered area as well on the Ultramar. Those seats were quite cushy! Nice! Great service. They even help you store your bags in a certain section of the ferry. It runs every 1/2 hour and after 8:30pm I think it runs less frequent. Maybe every hour??. Check on it before you go.
Good value - Easy transportation. All good...good value and easy. Cab ride from the hotel, buy round trip tickets and your off. The ferry runs every 30 minutes.
Enjoyable, safe, resonably priced.. Travelled Cancun - Isla Majeures. On time, clean, professional. Live music onboard added a very nice ambience.

Tried to rip me off!!!. I travelled from Playa Del Carmen to Cozumel to do some scuba diving. Unknown to me, the member of staff ripped the wrong part of the ticket off before I boarded at Playa. When I came to board the ferry back to Playa, I was told my ticket was invalid and I had to buy another one. I had already been allowed through the initial ticket inspection before I was told this. I explained that the agent at Playa had taken the ticket stubs, and this wasn't my fault. I was told tough and I had to buy another ticket. I refused to buy another ticket as I had already paid for a return ticket. The guy radioed his supervisor and he came back telling me I needed to buy another ticket. Being polite didn't work. The only thing that did work was going absolutely mental and keeping at it until they let me board.Total rip off merchants - they need to train their staff properly (unless it's a scam), it's not exactly rocket science to tear and retain the correct part of a ticket!!!! Whilst I was having my strop, an American couple told me they had done exactly the same to them. I'm assuming since they were boarding with a ticket and not going crazy, that they gave in and bought a new ticket. Nice money making scam. I loved the diving on Cozumel - saw turtles and dolphins. Just a shame the return trip was so stressful. And it all happened on my 30th birthday.

Perfect. Its cheapest go to isla mujeres from puerto juarez, at zona hotelera cancun its expensive. U can go from cancun center to puerto juarez in cab just for4 dlls, its like 7 minutes far from center.

Now with live music. I have been using UltrMar to get from Playa Del Carmen to Cozumel for ove 15 years and they are freindly and on time. Now they have music also. The trip is not cheap, about $25USD but is very convenient.

Good Safe and Fast Boats But Poor Logoistics. Departure locations and times changed without advanced notice. We did not know until we got off the bus that we the location had changed. Then we were given departure times when we purchased tickets however when we were in line for the boat, they removed two of the times.
On time and affordable. Very efficient, clean easy to get to from playa mujeres also nice view from top of ferry good photo opportunity

Great way to get to and from mainland but can be rough!. Took a ride on this ferry last week when there was weather in the area. Apparently from other reports, this can be a rough crossing even when weather is mild. You know its rough when inquired whether conditions as what we were in were common and "this, it's no bueno" is the response, so I appreciated the honesty and friendliness Of the crew. Several persons became ill and crew was immediately available to pass out bags and help out the sick. Although weather conditions cannot be controlled, how the situation was managed was, and extremely well in the circumstances. I definitely recommend that anyone already prone to becoming I'll takes precautions (such as medications), avoiding heavy/rich meals and a lot of water/drinks an hour before taking the crossing.

Easy transportation to Cozumel. Easy to find the ticket booth near the pier that is currently under renovation. The staff is very kind to those who get motion sick. They hand out bags as one starts to look like they will get sick. I thought that they were the better ferry to take - you could actually see out of the windows on this ferry.

Easy trip over . This service is reliable and good value.You can book your open tickets (leave whenever / return whenever) around town but better to do at the ferry terminal. About USD 6 each way. The ride over was very entertaining with a band and lots of people dancing! The ride back was very rough, they handed out sick bags before hand! The ferries are clean and there are many services each day.

Great!. I don't like boats. The swaying rocking motion, the thud after crashing over waves...... The Ultramar was great! Fast, clean and friendly. Everything i had hoped for.........To those who get sea sick, take a Gravol quick dissolve 30 mins before departure, sit inside, take a window seat and relax. It was a good experience.

Fast Service!. Very fast service, and clean ships every time I have traveled to Cozumel with them. It appears they are adding more ships to the fleet, which is needed as it seems to be more crowded each time.

Cozumel. This island is easily reached by ferry from Playa Del Carmen. You should avoid the ticket touts and buy from the ferry office. We hired a local 4 wheeler for the day though an agent on the pier. It cost us $50 + $20 for fuel. (refused the extra "insurance" - have own damage waiver cover). The cost with the extra insurance would have been about the same as hiring a taxi for a tour of the island. It was a fairly beaten up vehicle but got us around. There are lots of scooters and motorbikes in town which can make it tricky but the open road makes it enjoyable and the coast on the far side is lovely . There is some good snorkelling and then the coast opens out to wild, windy rocky beaches and azure seas. You can continue on foot if you like walking. The whole island seems to be limestone (fosilised coral etc). The rock pools and vegetation are interesting. You might want to take sandwiches etc so you can stop where you want.

Easy crossing. My husband and I were staying in Playa del Carmen and wanted a day trip to Cozumel. We got the UltraMar ferry which we thought was reasonably priced. We heard that the queues for tickets could be quite long so we got the tickets before wondering around town. There was plenty of seating for everyone and the water was a bit choppy so it was a little rough but not too bad. The ferry was on time and we were very satisfied with the journey and there were nice views in and out of the ports.

Nice ride. We took the UltraMar Ferry back and forth from Cozumel to Playa del Carmen twice recently. There was live entrainment on two of the trips and they were a fantastic distraction from the queasiness. Note that they do not always except credit cards. If there's a long line to get tickets prior to the departure time…you're out of luck. Have cash available (the nearby ATM were not working) Friendly staff, clean seats and did I mention the band!

Very enjoyable. We took the UltraMar ferry as part of our cruise excursion from the Cozymel port to Playa de Carmen. It was clean and comfortable and the staff worked very hard to make everyone's trip enjoyable.

Great - but only buy a one way ticket. We travelled from Playa del Carmen to Cozumel, pleasant fast ride and air conditioned inside.Would recommend you only buy a one way ticket as there are two different companies running ferries at alternate times, unless you know for definite the ferry times you want to travel on beforehand

Cheap and Easy to get to Cozumel. The ferry system is THE method to get to the island, be prepared for large numbers of people, all traveling with supplies... this is not a boat cruise. Easy to navigate on the Cozumel end, same as 5th avenue though.

Bumpy but fun ride to Cozumel. You can round trip for approx 300 pesos. The boats are med size and will bounce a bit if the water is chopy. Not good for those with sea sickness. On board you can buy drinks and chips. Live music and quick to cross to the island

Good ride across from Cozumel to Mainland Mexico. One of cruise ship stop was in Cozumel and we took boat from Cozumel to Mainland to go to resort and ruins. Boat was clean and has food and drink available. Boat ride is about 45 min each way and over open ocean so it is quite rough. Many of passenger couldn't keep what they had for breakfast. They do provide burp bags ... Most of us had no problem, but if you suffer from sea sickness then think twice.

FAST AND EASY WAY TO COZUMEL. I found this to be the fastest and easiest way to arrive on the island of Cozumel. The ferry leaves from Playa del Carmen every 2-3 hours until 10pm. You will arrive within 30-40 minutes depending on the conditions of the seas. I found this mode of transportation very economical during my Riviera Maya tour costing 163 pesos one way. I stayed in Cozumel a week and returned via ferry back to Playa del Carmen to catch a bus from ADO terminal for the airport. Everything is very close together. On the other side if you decide to land in Cozumel by plane and want to visit Playa del Carmen for the day you can do so taking the ferry up until 9pm. Take advantage of the UltraMar convenient transportation the next time you visit the Riviera Maya. Happy Travels!!!!

Taken twice before, this time got Mexico Waterjets. I have to say our experience on UltraMar was much better than Mexico Waterjets which is the one that runs the opposite hours. The boat we got with Mexico Waterjets (the noon one that leaves Cozumel to go to Playa) was awful. The top "outdoor" section is only open on the back so it's pretty enclosed and spells like fuel fumes. The lower enclosed air condition has windows which at first I thought were frosted but I think it might be layers of dried salt so you can't see out. The two times we've been on Ultra Mar they have a nice open section on top so you can see where you're going and catch the fresh air.We will make sure we plan our departure next time to get UltraMar for a better (less nauseous) experience.

Great service - loved the music too!. Reading previous reviews, I worried about seasickness. No need at all! The ride was just fine, well-organized, and had the added enjoyment of an entertaining group of musicians/singers. Half-price with INAPAM card.

Whoa!. Ok, the water was super choppy and I was green. That staff did everything they could to make me comfortable for the 40 minute crossing. The ferry was clean, smelled nice. The bathrooms were clean as well. The staff was amazing and I highly recommend UltraMar when you need to get from Cozumel, Mexico to Playa Del Carmen. We arrived via Carnival Cruise Lines.

Rough seas ahead.... Took the 11 am Ferry from Playa del Carmen to Cozumel. It was a windy day and the boat was swaying back and forth. The crew was very pleasant and quickly distributed vomit bags. The transfer took over 45 minutes and many got sick. The return ride was equally rough. If you get motion sickness easily, avoid the ferry.

great way to visit Cozumel Island. Very convenient way to visit the island from Playa del Carmen. As advised just buy a one way ticket so you don't get stuck with one of the two operators who travel back and forth.Good little band on ferry who help the journey go by.Beware that there are no ferries by either company between 2 and 4pm!

Choice-Good value-Fun-. Pleasant 45 minute water ride both ways.Best is to buy a 1 way ticket.If you buy a return ticket, you are stuck with the schedule of 1 of the 2 providers that leaves you less options for a return.Never a problem to get a ticket.There is some local music played on the boat that an individual can embrace, or slide away from.If so, sit in the back and don't complain.Cost was a simple and good value $13/way - $26 return
great ride to cozumel. you have 2 reasonable ferry choices to Cozumel and both are great. You will have musical entertainment both directions, making the ride always pleasurable

Excellent Service, Friendly Staff. My mom and I were going on a shore excursion to the Mayan Ruins and had to take the ferry to get to Playa del Carmen. This ferry crew are AMAZING!! From the moment, we stepped on the ferry, they greeted us, offered us drinks and I spoke to them in Spanish (I have been learning Spanish for six years and am trying to become fluent in the language!). We didn't really know where to sit so we sat on the lower deck, closest to the water. The water can get quite a bit bumpy and they give everyone barf bags just in case! The people we sat behind got seasick and I am very surprised that we didn't follow suit. The ferry crew were amazing at coming around and helping the people that were sick and making sure those who weren't were feeling okay! Since, we had to go on the ferry twice, we talked to many travelers who suggested to sit on the top deck of the ferry (the sea air helped make you feel less sick!). We tried that and it really worked! It was nighttime when we came back and a completely dark ride through the open waters but, my mom and I felt so much better sitting on the top deck then, the other deck that we rode on. The ferry crew was the same as we had seen much earlier in the day and they remembered us and talked to us for a while! SUCH a friendly crew aboard this ferry definitely sit on the top deck though if you are nervous about the ride!

Quick, clean and inexpensive.... This is the best way to travel between the mainland and Cozumel. We took three trips to the mainland while in Cozumel and between Ultramar and Mexican WaterJets we much preferred the Ultramar ferry's, as their boats were better and cleaner. Just know that sometimes they have issues that cause the schedule to unexpectedly change (happened to us). So, make sure to plan on catching an earlier ferry back, so you have a back up in the case of that change. Also, if you transport your dive gear with you back/forth, watch it from the moment it is being offloaded and you will be able to pick it up right off the deck after the other luggage is removed or directly from the baggage supervisor without having to worry about it (a couple dollars goes a long way in making this a faster smoother baggage pick up).

Seasick!. My husband and I are not ones to get seasick. We booked a tour of the local ruins through our cruise ship which included the 1/2 round trip on this ferry from Cozumel to the main land. We had a thunder storm the night before and the water was still quite choppy. We were told we would be fine and to board the ship. We were fine until they hit open sea, they were travelling WAY too fast for the conditions, it was impossible to stay in your seat. Staff members were going around checking on everyone as one by one everyone started throwing up. They had tiny plastic barf bags for you! I. luckily did not get sick (barely) but my husband was not so lucky...I can't imagine if the ferry was full and everyone was throwing up, would have been horrid. Thankfully there were only a few families on board.

$26 USD?????. You have to pay $26 USD for a round trip 30 minute ferry ride to Cozumel. They run pretty regular but the last one back to Playa de Carmen is at 7pm so don't miss the boat! You can buy snacks on board.

Day trip from Cozumel to Playa del Carmen. Day trip from Cozumel to Playa del Carmen. Ultramar is one of two companies that run between the two cities. Ultramar departs every other hour (refer to schedule) with the trip lasting between 40 and 50 minutes to cross the channel. The ticket offices take both Peso and American Dollars. The boats appeared to be in very good condition with indoor and outdoor seating, concessions, bathrooms and flat screened TVs. Boarding/exiting is conducted from both the front and back of the ferries and is open seating. Oversized luggage will be checked on boarding and reclaimed boatside at your destination. Tips: Depending on the weather/sea conditions, the ride can be bumpy. If your prone to becoming sea sick, plan accordingly. Only purchase a one way ticket (no discount for round-trip), then you can take whatever ferry is sitting at the dock when you want to leave. Exit the boat from the rear, it seems like everyone heads for the front and it gets congested.
Great service! amazing boats.... the only problem,, they ruined the open ocean experience with the loud musician playing guitar and singing something that was barely understandable...

Great round trip experience. We traveled to Playa Del Carmen MX and had an easy walk to the ferry to go to Cozumel. There is some construction going on nearby so one should be careful walking around. The important thing to remember is to not buy round trip tickets. The reason for this is the two ferry companies work with each other on an every other hour basis. So if you bought r/t tickets you would have to wait until that particular ferry departed even though the other ferry was leaving sooner. It's kind of confusing but when you get there you will understand.

Ferry ride over. Had a stress free ride from playa to Cozumel and back. They ferry was prompt and on time. The boarding and offloading was quick. Our big recommendations were to only buy one way as you don't get a round trip discount and you can choose between two ferries with different time schedule. We ended up going back on same one due to the time we wanted to leave Cozumel.

Returned us to a different dock then the one we departed from. We took the Ultramar Ferry from Cancun to Isla Mujeres and everything was fine on the way there. Left ontime right at 9:00am. We left from Playa Caracol which was a super short 5 minute walk from our hotel. On our way back they said Playa Caracol was closed due to bad weather, but the weather was not bad. They were running a little late and I think they just wanted to make up time, annoying to say the least. They dropped the entire boat off at Playa Tortugas which is about 3 miles away. It wasn't the end of the world, we figured out how to get on the bus and made it back to the hotel. Other then that, everything was as advertised. Music on the ferry is pretty corny but entertaining.

Great and comfortable ride. The rides were $17 dollars rountrip and free for young children under a certain height. We were comfortable and fast ride to isla mujeres. My mom who is claustrophobic and doesn't do boats did very well.

Efficient. The UltraMar Ferry is one of two ferry companies that share the route from Playa Del Carmen to Cozumel and back. Ferry service runs every hour on the hour.UltraMar has a very clean, spacious, and air conditioned vessel. If you want, you can sit on the second deck which has no windows and thus is open to the breeze. There is a small bar on the lower deck that serves snacks and drinks.For a family of 4 (3 adults, 1 child) we we able to pay using a Visa credit card 3 separate times (about 600 pesos). However one time on a trip from Playa Del Carmen to Cozumel, they told us cash only. Not sure why. Also they severely questioned the age of my daughter. She is 11 but 5'4" tall and they gave me some grief when I presented a child's ticket for her.Other than that tough, the ferry is a quick (45 minutes), easy ride between San Miguel and Playa Del Carmen. The ferry was always on time and the ride was always comfortable.One thing to keep in mind is that sometimes there is no 9:00pm ferry. Not sure why that is, but we got caught by that once and had to stick around Playa Del Carmen for the 10:00pm ferry instead. Also the two ferry companies share hours, so it is probably not a good decision to ever buy a round trip ticket.

Efficient Service. We had a great journey over to Cozumel. The ferries were clean and efficient. It cost £6.50 single. It is better to buy two singles as there are two ferry operators. This gives you the opportunity to be flexible and use either operator.

Live music. Took the ferry to Playa del Carmen, did not expect to have such a great time - band was great!! Drinks and snacks are served and the water is the most amazing blue color. Ferry docks right at Senior Frogs, and the shopping is all close by.

UltraMar does not return packages left on Ferry. My family and I have traveled to Isla Mujeres more than 8 times using the Ferry. The most recent trip, we left a duty free package mistakenly. We arrived at the port in Isla at 12:30 pm. I returned to the port at 1:30 pm trying to retrieve the goods with no avail. The run around I was given was ridiculous. So don't expect returned goods if you leave them on UltraMar!!! They will not help you get your belongings back. Very disappointed...
Grat Trip. Nice ride, with a great Latin band playing both legs of the journey, the boats are fast and comfortable, just try and get there a bit before sailing time, and you will get a good seat
Neat way to Cozumel. It is pretty cool to take this boat ride to Cozumel. It is air conditioned and comfortable and reasonably priced.

ferry to playa. It was air conditioned. They did walk around selling beverages, water, sodas, etc. Plenty of seating. We thought it was strange on the way to Playa, the screen was showing what to do in cozumel.
Very good transportation!. We used Ultramar Ferry from Cozumel to Playa del Carmen. The ferry is very well kept, clean, AC inside, as well as TV for entertainment. Great choice!

Ferry to Cozumel. Take the ferry across to Cozumel. There is entertainment on the 35 minute ferry ride. Rent some scooters and tour this island. You can travel down the east coast taking you to Punta Sur and travel through the Ecologic Reserve. Then travel back to the city via the west coast. You will not be disappointed!

Bad organization!. This company offered it services in a huge nd important event in Cozumel in which they didn't organize the timing. Their schedule sucked nd didn't match with the Sacred Mayan Journey that was held in the island two days ago. Many ppl lost the arrival nd departure of the oars because they bought tickets with them. Please don't offer something that u cannot provide well.

Cozumel to PDC. We used the ferry twice during our last trip. PDC to Cozumel and return. The ferry is clean and comfortable with AC inside. Boarding the ferry in PDC can be a little bit of a challenge for someone who is tall. The opening was only about 4 1/2 ft tall. This might depend on whether high or low tide. On the return trip - 7 am ferry, the ferry left 15 mins late. Not a pick deal if you allow for the extra time in your schedule. The cost was 163 P one way. Understand that the fee is going up.

Nice ride!. While staying in Playa del Carmen, decided to check out Cozumel, as we had not been there in years. The ferry runs roughly 7am to 9pm every hour. The sales guys at the kiosk suggest to go one way, then buy one way back - no change in cost vs. round-trip. This was great because if you buy round-trip, you only have certain times to come back, w/the one-way you have more flexibility. It was a last minute decision for us, but we still got on - it was packed - holds about 450+ people. Because we were all but last, we ended up on top in the sun. It was nice - but bring a hat, just in case - it's toasty w/o shade! I get sea sick VERY easy, so I was pretty concerned, and was frankly glad to be outside. No sea sick at all, pretty smooth ride and only took about 30 mins.On the way back, we got in line earlier and were seated on the inside - it was quite plush, very air conditioned and extremely comfortable-yes, you're packed in there, but the seats are very roomy, so you don't feel squished. Again, very concerned about sea sickness, but I did fine, no problems at all, even though we sat on a side, rather than in the middle. They offered drinks, snacks (for sale) and played 'commercials' for attractions. Was very impressed the whole process and look forward to doing it again!

!! To Cozumel. !! :). I took. The ferry on playa del carmen to travel to Cozumel , it takes only 45 min , and it's calm,nice and and live music, the only bad thing is the price , but you would enjoy the island of Cozumel , have fun !!!
Very good. We took this ferry twice during our stay in Cozumel and it was convenient and comfortable each time.

Just relax for 45 minutes.. Great ferry - we sat downstairs in the comfy seats with the air con, plug in your own music, close your eyes and before you know it you are arriving in Cozumel! They sell drinks and crisps etc. on the ferry!Just buy a one way ticket and then another one on the way back - that way no problem of having to wait a long time.You will be hounded all the way to the ferry queue by people wanting to sell you tickets, excursions for diving etc. etc. - don't be sidetracked!! Just go to the regular ticket desk and buy a one way - no problem and even though the queue appears long - there is lots of room!

Great ride-- DON"T buy round trip though. They had live music and it was interactive and fun. Well kept boat. Awesome tripThe only thing is they push you to buy round trip (and why wouldn't you, you're going back) yes but their schedule is opposite of the other ferry's schedule which is another company. So just get one way and then when you are done in sightseeing, buy your return with which ever one is sooner. It might be with this one, but it beats waiting 2 hours when you've just missed one.

Good idea but needs improvement. We took this ferry twice to and from the cruise port. On our way to our tour they picked up our excursion tickets when getting into the ferry. The ferry seats were comfortable and they kept playing a video in loop of tourist places. The bar staff was very friendly and greeted the passengers. Too bad I cannot say the same for the rest of the staff they were too busy on their phones playing and telling each other jokes. I stop one of them to ask a question and you would have thought i had asked her something improper. She did responded but with an attitude, the bar runner guy joined us and attempted to correct the girls attitude. Once we got off the fairy the passengers seemed lost since they did not have the tickets to their excursions which had more details like excursion number, etc. On our way back we sat on the outside this was better you did not feel the water sloshing and bumping of the water. In the interior we saw lots of people sick but in the outside it was so smooth. The seats are not as soft but its a short ride to the dock. We had some ferry guy come and give us instructions in broken English and in a voice volume that you could not hear anything. He repeated his speech three times but yet people still did not hear or understand. Next thing we notice they are passing a bucket for tips. The bar runner guy told him to repeat his speech for our area but he made a gesture and walked away. So the bar runner guy told us a summary of what the first guy had said.

Cozumel ferry. Was excited to take the ferry to Cozumel during our stay in the Maya Riviera. We did not realize Cozumel was so close! We were able to use a credit card for the fare. It only took about a half hour to cross. Even though the lines can be long, they have many boats. So don't worry if you think you won't fit on the ferry! There was space for everyone inside. The ferry is clean, but the bathrooms are not great. So wait until you get to the dock and use those if you need.

Useful and you have one every hour. They are two companies working and you have a ferry leaving every hour. The cost is 155 pesos (around 13 US $). It cost the same buying 2 single tickets than a return one so although is a pain to the queue twice, you might want to see which company is leaving first at the time of your return and buy your ticket then.You can purchase drinks on board. Trip is around 50 min. Pretty easy. The only bad thing are ones cutting lines, pushing, etc. Shameful to say that this behaviour was displayed by the visitors and the locals. I am wondering what these people would say if we saw the same behaviour carried on by visitors at home. Ferry had plenty of seats. If you tend to be cold, be aware that there is a strong air con inside so head upstairs for outdoor seating or bring something to cover up. Enjoy Cozumel and its beautiful waters.

Fast and cheap!. The ferry from Playa Del Carmen to Cozumel was fantastic. It was fast, efficient and great service. The staff take your bags upon boarding, there are comfy seats inside to sit on or you can take in the fresh air and sit outside. The line for the ferry to Cozumel was huge as it was peak season, but on the way back it was quicker and quieter. The ride itself was pleasant. There were a few bumps but overall very enjoyable. There are two services available, however due to our departure and arrival times, the UltraMar was the one going when we wanted to leave.

Ride up top if you can.. We used this ferry from Cancun to Isla Mujeres for a half day trip. The ferry is clean, the service prompt and it is all very accessible. The ticket counter only takes cash, so plan accordingly. Also, there is a "dock" fee that adds a couple of dollars per person above the advertised prices.We rode up top on the way over, and inside on the way back. It can be a rough ride depending on the waves, which for us made it kind of fun.
fast ferry!!. Fast ferry that took us across from playa de carmen to Conzumel. Great time, snack avaliable in the boat. nice view of both place from the boat.

be adventurous and take the ferry. Try taking the ferry over to cozumel when in playa del Carmen - what fun! People going to work, back packers and tourists - all together bouncing about on the beautiful carribean sea. The hire cars are a sight to see - we hired what we thought was to be a volkswagon "herbie" convertible - metallic green and held together with ties - even mod con air conditioning via the hole in the floor!! Still, we certainly attracted a lot of interest and still grin about our adventure some 5/6 months on.Travelling around Cozumel is easy enough and the beautiful coast line will take your breath away, white horses all the way. Don't bother paying for costly trips - even if you could find one. The booking office for the ferry is easy to find and not over crowded nor expensive. The shops in Cozumel,'s main street cater for the "rich cruise shippers" and have security on the doors - ready to protect all of the precious jewels and metals - what a dazzling site. Venture further in and you will find all of the usual bars/cafes and market stalls - all willing to haggle - and make sure you do. All in all, a great day and still giggling about our day in "herbie"!

Two Different Cozumel Ferry Lines. From our hotel in Playa, we took a taxi because it was a bit too far to walk (and it was hot). A suggestion we took was only purchase a one way ticket. That way, you can leave on the ferry leaving right away and on the way back, go to the ferry line which has the next ferry to depart. The price of 2 one way tickets is the SAME as a round trip ticket. They will try to sell you a round trip ticket but we are so glad we didn't. On the way back, the ferry leaving when we were ready to go was actually the other company. Otherwise, with a round trip ticket, we would have ended up waiting another hour...The ferries are wonderful and clean. No worries there!

Our first ferry experience won't be our last.... We have been to Cozumel 3 times now and this was our first time that we have taken the ferry. We found it to be very enjoyable and was impressed by the fast, friendly, clean, comfortable, efficient and overall fun experience.

Ultra seasick. I never got sea sick until I rode on this ferry .Bring a barf bag. (they provide bags if needed). Take some sea sick pills 30 mins before boarding. It gets hot (a/c is too weak) so bring a fan.

Fun Day.. Fast service to isla mujeres. Isla Mujeres was fun. Rented a golf cart ans saw the entire island. Tasted food from local vendors on the cheap. Excellent food and overall a great day. Would recommend it highly. Only negative is that everywhere in Mexico they want you pay for the restroom which I think is ridiculous. And the tipping everywhere you go is outrageous.

A nice comfortable ride from Cozumel to the mainland. This was the most comfortable boat ride I've ever taken. The trip takes 40 minutes each way. The cost is a little steep at $13 each way. Do not buy round trip as you will most likely be taking the other ferry back to the island. The air conditioning aboard really helps with sea sickness as well. I took Dramamine and had no issues with sickness.

Ferry to Cozumel. Nice but loud and crowded. They do serve beer and soft drinks but they have a band and if you sit close to the front of the sun deck it can be a little loud. It is very crowded and you will more than likely get stuck sitting next to someone you don't want sitting next to you.

UltraMar--super Beware of Taxi Scam. Be sure to tell your taxi driver that you want UltraMar Ferry, you best ride to Isla Mujeres. We made the mistake of asking for the ferry at Playa Tortugas and we left off at Mexicana. Horrible! Bad boat and only had 2 trips 10:00 and return at 5:00.

Nice Ride. My wife and three teen agers went to Cozumel for the day and had lunch at the Hard Rock. We enjoyed the ride and sat outside both ways to enjoy the experience. The ride back was at sunset and had live music, we loved it and would do it again in a heartbeat.We paid about $24 for a round trip ticket.
Live Music and Drinks on the Ferry. The ferry is a very enjoyable experience. Live music on the upper deck, open air, and great views of the ocean.

Fun Ride to Cozumel. Excellent and fun trip! Hope the waves are down, can see bad sight in bathrooms at end of journey due to seasick people giving it up! Buy a one way ticket because there are two ferry companies and the alternate hourly so never buy your return ticket until just before you actually elect to return.....

Ocean Breeze or Air Conditioning. Your option to sit downstairs in the AC or sit upstairs and have the breeze go through your hair. My husband sat in the ac and he said it was great, no worries about getting sea sick. I sat upstairs with the breeze, awesome. That's what its all about. On our way to Cozumel we were offered water, on the way back, not. It was still great. Plus you can buy a roundtrip ticket in advance so you don't have to worry about the ticket on the way back.

Quick, efficient, but stormy wavy day. We rode an early ferry to Cozumel. Everything went great with buying tickets, had a short wait in line, and then loading on the ferry in an efficient manner. This ferry is huge. Most everyone sat inside, it was an overcast, windy and rough seas day. Motion does not bother me but there were a few with sea sickness bags and definitely using them! The crew were passing them out right and left. The ride was nice, with an informational type movie up front. It was just a very wind stormy and overcast day. So windy, that when we got off the ferry and were walking to the taxi area, my arms were blowing up in the air- and I was even carrying heavy bags! We were on our way to deliver items to the orphanage there. But yes, we really liked the ferry ride... And want do do it again, especially when the seas are a but calmer. If you have a tendency to get sick, remember to take a pill before you get on. It will help a lot. ;)

Water Limo!. Man this company has grown in the last few years. These ferrys have super comfy seats with A/C and a TV playing something while you cruise across the water.The tickets are about 13usd each way and the ride from PDC to Cozumel is about 20-30 min depending on the water conditions.They sell snacks, water, beer.

Great ferry ride between Cancun and Isla Mujeres. While we were staying in Cancun we decided to go visit Isla Mujeres using the Ultramar ferry.I wanted to take it from Puerto Juarez since it is a lot cheaper, but getting the right information on how to get there from the hotel zone was a little hard to obtain. I got a lot of conflicting information from the front-desk, concierge, travel agency, etc...Some said that the ferry was the same price from Playa Tortuga, other told me that the only way to get to Puerto Juarez was to use a taxi, etc... So here is the real information, as of today at least. The round-trip ferry ride cost you 17.00$US from Playa Tortuga and about 10.75$US (140 Pesos) from Puerto Juarez so it is cheaper (about 6.25$US per person) from Puerto Juarez.There is a bus that goes from the hotel zone to Puerto Juarez, it is the R-1 Bus with "Puerto Juarez" written in the front window. Not all "R-1" buses go to Puerto Juarez, but from what we saw the "R-1 Puerto Juarez" bus runs about every 20 minutes. The bus ride from Park Royal hotel (middle of hotel zone) to Puerto Juarez took us 21 minutes.This bus let you out right in front of the Puerto Juarez Ultramar Ferry, and picks you up at the same place at the end of the day. No trouble at all !About the ferry ride, it is very frequent so you won't have to wait to long to catch one, and it is quite fast, about 15 minutes.This is a great way to get to Isla Mujeres and it is cheap so we enjoyed it and would recommend it.

Wish there was an alternative Ferry Service. We took the ferry from Playa del Carmen to Cozumel last week. Although, we were informed that the service accepted Visa credit cards, we were surprised when they pushed for cash only for one leg of the trip.For the return trip, I was much more firm with the agent and they accepted Visa as payment

check the schedule from isla to cancun. great experience from cancun to isla mujeres. 17 bucks rdtrp.. took the last ferry out but it was to puerto juarez not playa tortuga. more expensive cab ride back to hotel. however , ferry service was great. live music on ride back, under a starlit sky and mexicans singing out loud to their local music gave me goosebumps and made me smile.

Love Latinga playing on the ferry.. I seem to get lucky enough to hit the right hour for the Ultramar ferry when going over to Cozumel. Nothing gets you in the Island mood so fast as a nice cold cervesa on the weather deck listening to the guys from Latinga, ship band, while looking at the water. They play on tips only, so give a little. I bought the CD and loaded it on the iPhone. Good Stuff. This trip they saw us and the bags heading to the dock and held the ferry a minute to let us get on. Great company! Be sure though not to buy a round trip ticket, unless you are willing to wait. The two ferry companies alternate hours, more or less, throughout the day.

The easiest way to get from Playa to Cozumel. There are actually two ferry services, and they alternate crossings, so don't buy a round trip ticket... you might very well want to come back on teh other line. They also do NOT run every hour - there are some gaps - and we got skunked that way, having to wait aroung in Playa for an extra hour.The ferries are pretty comfortable, and have a lot of capacity. Both sell snacks and cold drinks, but no coffee - get it before you board. Th ewhole deal takes about 45 minutes, including boarding.

Items Left Returned To Owner. While visiting Playa Del Carmen, a person in our group accidentally left some merchandise along with a very expensive camera at Captain Dan's. Jorje from Ultramar was kind to get the merchandise back and contact us in order to get the items back to their owner. Our friend was not very optimistic of the merchandise's returns as expensive items were accidentally left, but two days later we met with Jorje and some of his friends from Ultramar and everything that was in the bags including the camera was returned! The friendliness and honesty of the Ultramar employees is outstanding. I recommend their ferry service very much!

Nice way to get to Cozumel from Cancun. After spending 3 days in Cancun we headed to a rental house on Cozumel via the ferry from Playa Del Carmen. It should be noted that there is no ferry from Cancun to Cozumel. You actually have to travel about 30 minutes down the coast to Paya del Carmen to take the ferry. The ferry runs all day once an hour and costs about $12 one way. There are two ferry companies that provide service. Mexi-jet and Ultramar. Both offer the same services and both take about 30-35 minutes to make the crossing. If you are prone to seasickness do not sit inside on the front as it is quite the rocky ride. I enjoyed sitting on the upper open deck on the stern of the boat.

Just about everyone was seasick. I think I might have been the only person on this entire boat who was not seasick, and that took some effort on my part. The ride was extremely rough and people were throwing up everywhere, faster than the staff could hand out the little blue barf bags. We saw a much larger UltraMar ferry sitting in the dock; I don't know why they were using the little ferry, but it was a very rough passage. The sea didn't seem to be overly rough. At the end, they pulled out a big hose to wash all the vomit off the deck, so I guess this is something they are used to.We spent all day in Cozumel being worried about the return trip and another forty-five minutes of people throwing up everywhere.. the sea seemed to look much wavier and rougher later in the day, so we took a chance and booked the return ticket with another company called Mexico Waterjets. It was a world of difference. The ride was so calm in comparison, even though we could SEE huge waves, we did not feel them on the much bigger boat, and it was only thirty minutes rather than forty-five. I would absolutely not recommend travelling with UltraMar unless they are using the bigger of their ferries-- our ride on the smaller one was simply awful.

Great ferry ride between Cancun and Isla Mujeres. This is an easy way to travel to Isla Mujeres from Cancun ($17 round trip). The ferry is fast and smooth. You can sit outside or inside in air conditioning. We rode one way outside and the retun trip inside. The outside benches were not padded, but the trip was less than 1/2 hour so that was okay. Hold on to your hats outside, though! We rode inside on the way back and it was very comfortable! High-backed, bus-like seats. Large windows but constant sea spray so not great viewing. The better viewing is from the outside seats (upper deck).

Good and safe experience. This is a top-class service, and I was very pleased to use the Ultramar ferry that joins Playa del Carmen and Cozumel / Isla Mujeres. It is fast, safe and very comfortable. I used it to spend the day in Isla Mujeres, and came back right before sunset. To make it better, there is free internet aboard and the tickets are very reasonable. Good experience!
Ferry to Cozumel. Quick, efficient ferry. The only issue I had was that you cannot use a credit card to buy a one-way ticket.
great trip over to Cozumel. Definitely worth at least 1/2 day to sightsee and find Margueritaville !! Great Lunch and atmosphere
Free Wifi!!!. Bring the laptop as wifi is free. Fast Fast ferry!!! Try to get a seat in the \back so you can keep an eye on your luggage.
get there early and bring water...long wait but worth it to get a seat. worth it to get a seat to get there early to sit outside, near ocean and breeze on hot day to cozumel!
Clean and fast. The boat was clean and it was only about a 30 minute ride to Cozumel. Cost was roughly $24 round trip. Book one way tickets though.

Cozumel. Reasonable rates. Not a good day, but definitely worth seeing.
Beware of car rental thieves!! They completely ruined our day.

easiest way to get to Isla Mujeres. Ultramar is the fast boat (there's a slow boat but not regular and not that much cheaper) to Isla Mujeres. Cost 140pesos return. you can buy the return ticket from Cancun and use it anytime, there's no expiry on it. It runs every 30 mins and takes about 15-20mins, and air conditioned !

The Ferry to Cozumel. We always take this ferry over to Cozumel. You can sit inside with air-conditioning or sit uptop and catch some sun. There is always a small band on the upstairs level .... nice entertainment and they ask for tips at the end but not required. The have a man that comes around and offers you drinks/snacks for a price and they also have a consession area on main floor. And it offers bathrooms.I believe this ferry leaves every hour. When you buy you tickets only buy one way .... because there is another ferry that runs opposite to UltraMar .... so deciding on when you want to return you can pick which one best suits your schedule.Ummm I think its about a 40 minute trip or a little less.Cost is about $15 per person (adult) each way
Music and quick travel to Cozuem. Fast ferry to cozumel. Convient and about 40 minutes dock to dock.. Had a great band on board and served snacks and beer.....

Great little trip. we stayed in Cozumel and took a couple trips to the Playa del Carmen area. This ferry leaves on time every 30 min and makes constant trips back and forth. Its cheap, safe and great outdoor seating to see the beautiful coastlines as you approach the shores. One the one trip there was a band playing music inside which was a nice surprise. I think they offer drinks and snacks for a minimal price. Its a a great little trip in itself to travel across the channel.
visit Cozumel. departure every 30 minutes,best way to visit Cozumel.It takes only 45 minutes to get to Cozumel.Don't forget to visit San Miguel.
Ferry Ride. Great deal for $12.00 to go across from Cozumel to Playa Del Carmen. Watch out for unscrupulous taxi drivers if they think you are not going very far once you get there.

One of 2 ferrys to cozumel. You have a choice between this company and another company to go to Cozumel. They both charge the same price and the boat is the same. They run at opposite hours of the day.

Same as always. The ferry service between Cozumel and Playa del Carmen is a necessary evil. The temp is usually too cold inside, lots of fumes outside. At least this time of year there are not many people, so you get your pick of seats.

Crazy Ferry to Cozumel!. We were so not prepared for this ferry ride, but we had a blast. We ended up on this ferry 3 times on our excursions to Cozumel from Playa. Get ready for an exciting ride to say the least. We sat on the top and were entertained by a great live band that makes the trip fun and takes your mind off the rocking and rolling ferry. Yes the ferry rocks and rolls. My wife thought for sure she was going to get sick, but once the band started playing and everybody starts getting into it, she ended up having a great trip each time. There is no live music on the bottom level.Price: About 12-13usd per person one way.FYI: Only buy one way tickets at the ferry terminal. There are 2 different ferry companies leaving at different times. So if you don't want to be stuck wating to come back, don't buy round trip tickets. On our last ferry to cozumel we missed the ultra mar, but were able to buy tickets with the other company which were the same price, we were glad we didn't buy the roundtrip or we would have had to wait another hour for the ultra mar and we ready to get back to our hotel.P.S. If you have any mexican coins you want to get rid of take them to tip the band, they make their money off tips only.
Good ferry ride. All in all was a pleasant way to go to Cozumel and then back to Playa. Staff aboard the ferry were very nice and we were entertained with live music.

Ferry to Cosamel.. Water was rough and was sick the whole way. Staff on the ferrywere excellent. They were very passionate and caring, they couldn't do enough for you. I believe if the water was calmer itwould of been a pleasant trip.

going across. Those ferries operate in cancun and playa del carmen and having tried both locations; i can assure you it is a quick crossing both to isla mujeres or playa del carmen to cozumel.If it is a large boat it can still be rocked by bad weather. But all ships rock under bad conditions. The staff is o.k. , the utilities as well. Just remember it is a very short crossing so nothing to really worry about.
Prepared!. New n clean....staff was prepared w throw up bags and it was needed that day along w alcohol due to bad weather. On time n well organized. Clean bathrooms too

Fast. We traveled over to Isla...Took are little dogs ...They were so helpful with boarding and taking care of our puppies...Would do it again ...Very pleasent experance...We will go over soon and take the dogs...
good ride. no problem, well organized. nice wind blowing on a hot hot day...very relaxing day. i did get stung by a bee...unfortunately

Terrible Customer Service. When we were given our roundtrip voucher they tore off the part needed to come back, we ended up having to pay again to get back. They refused to get a manager for us and told us the ferry was leaving in 5 minutes and if we didn't get one we'd be left on Cozumel. DO NOT RECOMMEND. Use the other service and make sure they don't rip off both sections (which we didn't think to check or realize they did)
Great start to a trip to Cozumel!!. How can you go wrong with a live band playing......trip was a breeze and the staff was great. Buy tickets one way at a time so that you can leave on your schedule.

Quick & no sea sickness!. We took the Ultra Mar ferry back from Cozumel twice and it was modern, quick and on time.FYI- there are two competing ferries that go to Cozumel and they switch off hour to hour as to who's running, so only buy a one way ticket or you may be waiting over an hour.

Ferry from Playa to Cozumel. The ferry itself was good but I can do without the 'entertainment'.
I just wanted transportation to the island and enjoy the ride. Didn't want a party-boat.

quick service but just buy a one way ticket. You can always buy your return ticket on the way back and that way you can choose which one you travel on and you are not stuck waiting for a certain ferry to come and get you.

Rode 4 times in September with no problems. We rode the ferry to and from Cozumel and Playa Del Carmen and the ferry to and from Isla Mujeres and Cancun. Each trip left on time, was relatively affordable and was comfortable. The ferries all seemed to be built in the USA within the last 5 years.

So easy to access and very inexpensive. Great fun, indoors you can ride in the air conditioned, spotless and new cabin, or on the deck above in the sunshine and breeze where you may be serenaded by someone who plays an instrument, most often with a really bad voice but what the heck it's fun. You then tip the singer a few peso's for his songs you enjoyed while you crossed the water. There is help on either side of the Ferry if you want help with your bags.

Boats to and fro Cozumel. Boats are comfy and fast. Inside AC. Baggage well cared for-don't lose tickets. If you have definite schedule check the departure times on both sides of card. Boats leave and arrive at different times on diff days-usually alternating. Sometimes big gaps around 12:00 noon and 2:00 so go early if possible because they leave continually till noon, big pause for tacos, and many later in afternoon for workers

ALOT OF FUN!!. This is a great way to spend a day, go over to cozumel, the submarine rides are really cool, the sellers are a little more persistant, and the boat ride alone is alot of fun, music drinks, good time!!
Nothing special. The ferry is clean and nice, but is like any other the toll MXN$155 and the leave every hour only check the day because is different in odd days and even days.
Nice Trip. We enjoyed the ride and clean boat. The little band was a nice touch as well. Would like to have ridden on the top deck but that was closed for some reason
Go to Cozumel!!. A great trip to Cozumel to bar hop around the island!! Stop by the Money Bar, fish taco at Coconuts are awesome, Rasta's is a blast and Playa Bonita is a hoot!!

Quick, efficient but super rocky. If you're prone to sea sickness this Ferry ride is probably not for you. The design of the ferry doesn't do much to stabilize the rocking.Other than that the ferry was fast efficient, comfortable and well worth the ride to visit Cozumel.

the desk staff are rude rude rude but the musicans on board are amazing. I have been to mexico 3 times now and there is nothing like a day trip to couzmel but the ticket office staff are so rude. but the musicans on the boat are great, i bought there CD it was $10 bucks great buy

Awesome. You can go to Cozumel for really cheap with the Ultramar. Visit the island by yourself with the excursion (which I dont like because they do not give you enough time). We went there twice with the Ultramar. The ferry is right next to the hotel (PLAYACAR PALACE) and comes and goes every hour. We also stopped by the Cozumel Palace and ate there for free. At Cozumel we rented a Jeep for $50 to ride around the island with. :)

Live entertainment on a ferry.. We enjoyed the ride. Seemed like a quick ride. There is a band that plays going across to Cozumel and also when coming back..They were great! The terminal in Cozumel was nice too.
Great way to get to Cozumel. Loved the ride over to Cozumel and back would higly reccomend it, would do it again Just line up and go

It did what it was supposed to do.. It was on time, got me to and from Isla Mujeres (from Cancun), and comfortable. Ample seating indoors and outdoors. During the evening trip back, there was a musician on the top deck singing classics in various languages. Not a bad way to spend a Saturday evening. I thought the price was a little steep, but still in the reasonable range. Now, if only the guys behind me could stop talking for the 15 minute ride so I could actually hear the music.......

Quite expensive, too hot or too cold, and very noisy! not all bad though!. Not all bad, if you can sit outside without getting wet it can be a very enjoyable ride, unfortunately indoors they have air con blasting everywhere so you freeze, and they play a most annoying promotional video with very loud music and narration to accompany.on the top deck outside you sometimes get a band playing to entertain you which is usually very nice and they do bring round refreshments and things which you can buy but they are not fussy, toilets on board which is great ..just make sure you walk fast once you have got off so as to not get hassled by the people selling you tours, jeeps, scooters on the other side in cozumel or in playa! usually runs on the hour, but beware which ticket you have as there are two different companies which alternate every hour, and their schedule changes every month!

Nice way to travel to/from Cozumel. This is a fun way to get to/from Cozumel but if you go in the Summer, I definitely suggest sitting on the top (outdoor) part. I know that sounds crazy but the inside didn't have any cool air and with as many people as were on there, there was no air circulation. We sat inside on the way there and I thought I was going to sweat to death, but on the way back we sat on the top part and there was a nice breeze and you got to see more. Also whichever port you start from, just buy a one way ticket instead of roundtrip because there are two different companies at the port and when you are ready to come back you can see which one is leaving next. That way you don't have to wait an hour if you just missed the ferry from your roundtrip ticket.

Great convenient service to and from CZM. There are 2 ferry services from PDC to CZM and back. They run on alternate hours and are very efficient. It is best to buy one way tickets instead of round trip. That way if you decide to leave earlier or later you are not locked into one ferry service. They offer snacks and drinks on board.

Good convenient way to get to Cozumel. Got to the dock at 7am which was when their boat was going to leave. Every month is different. For the month of August the schedule went like this: odd days (1,3,5,7, etc.) had even times, such as 8am, 10am, noon, 2 pm departures. And the opposite for even days...they had odd times such as 7am, 9am, 11am, etc. Just check their website, they even have a twitter account. Anyways, getting back to the story....got there at 7am and asked if we could board. They responded tickets are around the corner. So we went there and were told it was 156 pesos or something like that for one way. It ended up being $25 roundrip. There were no peddlers, hustlers, or anything of that sort. We just saw a ticketbooth that read "Ultramar" and the yellow and blue, which are their colors. We boarded and left around 7:10 or 7:15. They are pretty punctual. No musician playing, no music period. No wallets stolen, no theft. None of what I read about terrible experiences. My wife said the morning ride was "peaceful, relaxing." Her and I get a bit seasick. Yes, it's true, you do get wet if you don't sit in the middle or are just on the wrong side. We got wet and moved to the middle just everyone else moved. No biggie. Got there in a half hour and same on the way back.We took the last boat at 8pm on that day. It was packed, but we arrived 30 minutes earlier. They had 3 boats lined up to take people back to Cancun. This time it was a bit late, not quite as punctual. Plus, there was a van that said "Funeral" on it near the dock, so we assumed some dead guy was getting transported by boat back to Cancun. It took awhile. Some people cut in line and hear whistles and some yelling at them. My wife and I sat inside in the AC this time. However, the waters are rougher during the night and she said she felt dizzy, disoriented, but not seasick. We had no problem with buying roundtrip tickets from this company.They have bathrooms, snacks for purchase, and wi-fi. They seemed pretty punctual for the most part and were courteous. You pick up the ferry at Playa Del Carmen. Just go to the dock and around that area you'll see the ticket booth. When you arrive at Cozumel, there is only one main dock there, so just tell the cab driver and you'll pick up the ferry exactly where you got dropped off. There was no confusion at all for us. I'd recommend taking this ferry to anyone.

Fast & Easy. We took Ultra mar from the port in Playa del Carmen. It was roundtrip $24/per person. typical outdoor/indoor seating. They have pull down shades to block the ocean splash if the sea is rough. Staff offered activities for Cozumel. We rented a scooter for the day for $25.

Ferry to Cozumel/Playa. The ferry itself is very convenient to get between Cozumel and Playa. It is very comfortable, has beverages and snacks and only takes about 45 minutes. The main thing I do not like about the ferry is the process to purchase tickets and boarding/unboarding the boat. First tickets - you really need to watch the people selling tickets - I have had them try not to give me my change twice! So be on your watch here. I suggest always buying one way tickets because there are 2 ferry companies that leave at different times and the tickets are not transferrable. So I have purchased a round trip ticket once and had to wait > 2 hours to return due to the hours of operation of the company I purchased it from. And you do not save any money buying a round trip ticket. But the sellers do not tell you that - they always assume you want a round trip ticket - so you have to say one way. Also, I find the tickets expensive - $156 pesos each way. The boarding/unboarding process is very unorganized and be prepared to find yourself having to push your way to get off.Oh and sometimes they have live music, which is nice, but be prepared to be hit up for tips at the end.

Ferry to Cozumel. Buy your tickets at the pier and don't be late! They go every hour and if you are a minute late you are not going for an hour. Only pay one way so you can come back when you want. Last ferry to Playa is 9pm so don't miss it and expect it to be packed. I loved Cozumel! Park in the parking area 2 blocks from the pier off the one way street? 10th?

Cozumel is a must see!. I love taking the ferry over to Cozumel! It has become one of our favorite destinations. This was our 3rd Cozumel visit and I hope there will be more. It is one of the most beautiful islands, when you get out of the city and see the actual beaches. I would easily compare some of the views to Hawaii and other Caribbean countries we have visited. Do yourself a favor and put Cozumel on a Must See list! The ferry experience is awesome, comfortable, easy and quick!
Ferry to Cozumel. The ferry to Cozumel was an experience you have to try when in Playa Del Carmen.It is a fun day trip if you are looking to break up your vacation.
FERRY TO COZUMAL. New, well cleaned, nice conditioning and extreme faster than the Mexican ferry. try to use this company for comfort.

An attraction in itself. I took both the UltraMar and Mexico Waterjet ferries back and forth to Cozumel. OK, I'm obsessed with riding boats and confess I did a round trip just for the thrill of it. There is Wi-Fi on both, the ferries are clean and spacious, and you will arrive on time even if they leave a few minutes late. There is air conditioned indoor seating as well as limited open air seating. Check the clouds as you may prefer to be inside during a storm. Be warned: I gave this an Excellent review, however, I do not suffer from sea-sickness. I overheard a woman tell her queasy husband, "Pues, por eso dicen que cruzar a Cozumel es cruzar a Cozumel", meaning, I guess that's why they say taking the ferry to Cozumel is what it is...and there's no way around it. The trips may not be suitable for the faint of stomach unless those people bring anti-queasiness remedies. There are attendants who moniter passengers for green-ness and will whip out plastic baggies for them. Some of my trips were less rocky than others, but for me the whole fun was in the other trips with their rhythmic extreme side to side swings that lead to us being airborne (over and over the whole trip, storm or no storm)...I don't know why the guidebooks don't warn people of this beforehand...

Good Ferry. Good way - and the only (?) to Cozumel. Enjoyed the ride - even though it came a shover. Don't rent a car at Cozumel before you actually can see the car... Easy to negotiate prices as there are a lots of cars to rent - and some of them are wrecks...The lighthouse and Ecopark at the southern part is great - but only open from 9:00 AM to 4:00 PM.

A bit overpacked on the last boat.. We traveled on the ferry back from Cozumel on the last ride at 9pm, disappointed that there was no 8pm ferry. It was hot and muggy and overpacked even though we were sitting in the open air section. I would recommend avoiding the last boat or sitting in the air conditioned area below with a window seat to avoid feeling seasick. Our other experiences with the ferry were fine, and I would recommend it as a good way to get to the island.
reliable and fast. The best ferry for getting around. Reliable, fast, clean and friendly staff.

Nice. Great ferry with free WIFI!! Be sure to buy one-way tickets to Cozumel so you can choose departures that leave every hour. If you buy a roundtrip ticket the options are only available in two-hour increments.

be ready to wait. nice ride and prices are fair but many show up at last minute to squeeze on, and it's irritating! If you want to ride up top for view Be ready for people to go in & out a billion times and bump into to you and sit on you. It's a zoo up top!

Fast and smooth!. This is a great way to visit Cozumel if you are staying in Playa Del Carmen---warning! They keep the a/c cranked up inside the ferry so take a tee=shirt or light jacket for the ride.

About as expected. Liked: it will get you from point A to point B
Disliked: the operators and ticket sellers are shady and questionable

Cozumel Ferry Ride. Flying into Cozumel and taking the ferry to Playa de Carmen can be great fun, but watch out for your return times especially if you are trying to catch a flight. The lines can be very long and the schedules may or may not work. But overall the rides are comfortable and fun!
Good.... On the way to Cozumel the trip was good, but on the way back they over booked the boat and there were people that couldnt get a seat... not fun, took forever to get out of the boat

Ferry to cozumel. We took a taxi from our resort to playa beach and got on a ferry that took us to cozumel.about $24.00 roundtrip. from there we took a taxi to a wonderful beach that was good for snorkeling.We brought our own goggles and snorkel.Just ask your taxi driver and they can recommend a good beach.Ours wasn t to far!The ferry took about 50 min.each way and you can buy water,beer,or softdrinks.We sat on the top outside so we wouldn t get sea sick.
efficient. Provided the service we needed. Buy the tickets from the blue, plywood building. Beware of the 100s of vendors trying to charge you more for the tickets.
