Nice ride to Cozumel. The ferry was a very relaxing way to get to Cozumel. The trip takes a little over an hour and you really enjoy the breeze and sea scenery. There was a live band playing which made our ride more enjoyable.
Good price. Clean and nice. not a bad price. They even had a band playing on the top level for entertainment for the 30 min ride! Free WIFI was available on the boat as well!
Excellent. Had a live band on the crossing they were great crew was very helpful.

Great ride, but pricey. I love to take the ferry, you have to take it you have any thing to do on the mainland but it sure cost a lot. But what you gonna do, u have to pay to get there, or go to cozumel. It's a great ride but the should be kinder to the picket books of the tourist, that want to see there country. My advice, if you take any tours get them to pay for your tickets.
Comfortalbe Modern boats. I take the ferry boats on a regular baseis from Cozumel and this is my favorite line. Ultramar boats are more modern and comfortable.
Super easy trip to Cozumel.. The ferry and its operators are first-class. I'm not sure there's much of an advantage to going to Cozumel if you're already staying in Playa, but the ferry ride is fun.

Best Way To Isla Mujeres!. I traveled to Isla Mujeres many times with Ultra Mar Ferry. Very reliable, comfortable and inexpensive way to spend some time on the island for sunbathing, clean beach, quiet times, great restaurant, beware - shopping is expensive but overall good place to take a break from crazy Cancun.

Get there EARY and sitin the back!. Ferry to Cozamel. Nice trip, and they treat you well. You can get a beer during the trip, and it is $ 2 per. The wind in your hair, and the sun on your face feels great. 2 boats per trip, so if you miss one, you will catch the next. We rented our jeep to see the island on the ferry, and it was $ 60 for the day. Least expensive anywhere on the island. FUN!!!

Comfortable Ferry Trip. We been taking the ferry for several years between Playa Del Carmen and Cozumel. Each year, they make improvements. The port in Cozumel is clean, they check your luggage and the ferries all seem to be well-maintained.

Pleasant ride!. I've taken this ferry numerous times over the years between Playa and Cozumel. I think this trip was the best one so far! The sun was shining, water was smooth, the band entertained us while we sipped a cold beer and it took exactly 35 minutes to cross. Excellent trip!

Expensive. We used the ferry for a day trip to cozumel and found the prices to be very expensive. We told the ticket girl we wanted round trip tickets and was charged roughly 40USD for them only to be told upon arrival at gatekeeper that they were one way tickets even though they had two separate stubs on the ticket. We noticed a woman next to us who had a different color ticket with a different price on it, so I dont know if we got screwed or not, but for the price it sure feels like it. Also the live band is very loud, and then they want tips. Try to sit on a lower level to avoid this!

Made it to Cozumel. . .but were soaking wet!. The ferry is efficient, clean and perfectly fine. BUT. . .unless you want to get wet, do not sit outside near the perimeter! We were "splashed" by two waves that went went right over our heads. The first wave slapped my friends face so hard that her glasses fell off. We were surprised (an understatement). If we had only picked different seats closer to the middle (away from the railing)! Otherwise, the ferry is fairly organized, cost effective, easy and comfortable.

Very fast. This ferry is ultra fast is actually a catamaran, we took it from Playa Tortuga to Isla Mujaher for a day trip. You can sit inside in air condition or upstairs in open air. cost was $17 round trip. Very good service.
Fun. We had a great trip over to Cozumel and loved sitting outside
Relaxing. Relaxing trip. Ferry was on time and the view of the Caribbean verses Cozumel or Playa Carmen was exquisite. No discount for purchasing a round trip ticket.
Ferry to Cozumel. Excellent - fare price - worth taking the trip (Cozumel is beautiful)
Nice way to travel.. We went over to Cozumel via ferry "just for something to do". Seemed a little expensive, but on vacation, .......who cares.
excellent service.. excellent service, very smooth and always on time.

Quick cheap way to and from the Mainland. We took this ferry multiple times on our trips to Cozumel to get to Playa Del Carmen and back for various attractions. The price is really good, it's a smooth quiet trip on a very clean boat with snacks and drinks available for purchase. You can purchase your tickets right at the port in a kiosk for the same price that you would buy them anywhere else. If you have an internet connection you can check the times of departure for ferry trips. It's almost an attraction itself rather than just a mode of transportation. Nice ride.

Ferry from Cozumel to Playa. The transfer from Cozumel to Playa was only about 35 minutes and they had a band play for us. It was great and made the time go by really fast. You have to get there early to get a seat on the top floor which is where the band plays.
They do the job....... We went to Cozumel and took the 8 am. service. Nice boat where you can sit outside or inside. Easy transfer. And they were on time.....!

Lots and fun. Always on time, comfortable and the newer faster ferries have a band that plays. They are excellent, I even purchased their CD. You can rent a vehicle while on the ferry to drive around Cozumel. Very reputable. Just remember to take your license.

Very professional. Took the UltraMar ferry over to Cozumel. The swells were pretty significant that day so it was a rocky ride. A few people lost their lunch. But it was clear this ferry company is very professional and focused on passenger comfort. They even had a small band playing music for the return ride. I believe they have a big catamaran that is probably smoother than our mono-hull was.

quick and efficient. took to conzumel from playa del carmen. bought a one way ticket so I could take whatever ferry back (As there are two companies and the trade off ever hour so coming back if you want to return at a specific time and bought a roundtrip you might have to wait an extra hour.

Cozumel service. Couldn't be in Playa del Carmen without a quick ferry ride over to Cozumel which is Mexico's largest island. Just went over to have lunch and came back. Price was ok and it was only about 1/2 hour each way.
great service. Liked the trip.excellent service and live music on board - even bought their CD :)

Getting to Cozumel from Cancun. The 40 minute ride was comfortable even with 6 foot waves! The crew was courteous and did not bother you with a bunch of 'buy it now' nonsense. The band was very good and did a variety of songs that passed the time more quickly. Once in port, the disembarkation was easy and smooth to get to our final destination. Definately the best way to get to the island other than by plane.

Cozumel ferry. Took Ultra Mar to Coz. Good ride with loud entertainment in Spanish. Took about 45 minutes. Very professional baggage handling The other ferry service was more blue collar. Throwing the bags up and over the railing. It was also mh faster, getting us to Playa in a half hour. No entertainment, which, in my opinion was a good thing.
great day trip. very convenient,air conditioned,reasonable,only about 10 minutes away from the resort ,cab ride is $7

Dependable ferry. The ferrys between Cozumel and Playa del Carmen is fast and dependable, but be careful to buy only a one way ticket unless you are positive about your return time. The companies do NOT honor each others tickets.
Tickets.... Good service, but try and book it one way as there are 2 lines and don't have the same departure time. Cost is the same.

Goin to Isla Mujeres. Take this tip- when you are in downtown Cancun, look for the bus Red # 1 that takes you to Hotel Zone and will take to Puerto Juarez - it's cheaper if you depart from there, pay in pesos that is better. It's almost half hour ride and its a beautiful view, The beach is enormous and very clean, you can eat fresh fish and have some tequilas or margaritas at the town. Very friendly people. You r gonna love it, so dont miss it if you go to Cancun or Playa del Carmen

45 min and your in COZUMEL!. about $10 for youyr 45 min ride across the open waters of the Carribean! Youll hardly feel like Johnny Depp aka Captain Jack, but you will get to see Cozumel and see Playa Del Carmen from a whole new perspective. The bost is fun and usually there is a guitarist on board playing music.
reliable route to cozumel. inexpensive-runs on schedule-easily accessible-terminals at each end are easy to find-lots of seating on board-able to purchase cold drinks

Luxurious crossing in the first level!. Gave it very good rating because of the unexpected comfort found in the bottom level with AC and super comfortable seats. However the price is too high I think at $13US. The other disappointment is that I was offered to buy a two way ticket and presented a time table that did not fit my needs but not told that another ferry company offered the crossing as well. I bought the two way ticket only to find out later that another ferry company with a timetable that better fits my needs was available. I ended up wasting the money spent on the return leg by buying a one way with the other ferry company becasue I needed to be back in Playa del Carmen at a certain time.
Nice ferry ride. This was a good ferry ride but as usual the photos were a total rip off. I'd use their service again. It was convenient, well priced and the staff was friendly.
Great value and entertainment!. the ride over to Cozumel was very affordable and enjoyable... we especially loved the band that played on our way to and from the island - they were great!
35 minutes ride. Sit on the back of the ship, so you won't get dizzy
1/2 hour trip. Very rough ride over to Cozumel...they did have a band playing which was great.

Confusing and Not accommodating. There are two ferry company's that make the commute between Playa Del Carmen and Cozumel. My first advise is do not purchase a round trp ticket. And if you don't purchase round trip you are forced to pay cash. AND if you pay in USD, you pay more.The ride itself is very pleasant, even had a local band entertain us one morning on the 8:00 run. Watching the cruise ships coming in to Cozumel was something new to us as we do not visit the populated destinations as a rule.One thing, there are some very rude tourists who feel they own an entire row of seating.Upon our arrival at Playa, I did hear of some wallets and purses had gone missing. Not sure why they are not keeping an eye on their belongings.The times fluctuate every day. The ferry that left at 7 one morning will leave at 8 the next day. This is simply my recommendation to be weary when using this transportation. It is reliable and safe, just not consistent as a public transportation user from the US.Again, nice ride. Just want to let you all know of the schedule and fares that can be confusing..
Ferry to Cozumel. Loved the live music on board! Made us forget all about the rough seas
ferry to cousumel island. it was fast, and nice trip over.comfortable, and great way to get to cousumel island for a day trip

Fast transportation. Visited Cozumel with this ferry in the worst conditions (the port was closed after our return due to the bad weather). Unfortunately I suffer from sea-sickness so this did not make my ride very enjoyable.In better conditions though it is a fast ride on a nice ship and the staff was very attentive for helping out people with difficulties due to the roughness of the sea.Mad props to the band being able to stand up and play all kinds of songs while the rest of us were fighting to just stay seated.

A fun trip to Cozumel!. EASY and affordable! We were surprised to find that there was a band that would be entertained the 45 minutes across the ocean to Cozumel! Made the trip go fast, and comfortable too.

A Fun Ride. We took the UltraMar Ferry to Cozumel to meet our dive boat. They had a band that played for the entire trip across. It was fun and entertaining and even though the seas were very rough that day, the trip was very enjoyable.

Really Wasn't As Bad As I Feared. I was very hesitant about making the trip from Playa Del Carmen to Cozumel on this ferry. Mostly because I had heard horror stories from friends regarding the whole motion sickness issue. I'm happy to say that was not the case..for me anyways.It was obvious from the stains on the seats that not everyone was so lucky! All in all I found the ride quick and the seating very comfortable. It was nice to be able to buy a drink on board should you want one also! My only complaint would be that they could have done a better job cleaning the boat.
Ferry ride to Cozomel. To the ferry to Cozemel for a Snorleling tour. The ferry ride was great. They even had a live band playing on the trip over.
Rocky ride. Tickets are for sale at the yellow booth behind the terminal. Lots of street vendors will try to sell you tickets. Avoid them.
Cozy Cosumel. Nice tour at affordable price. Island is small but quint. Ilsa de Mujeres is a little gem in itself.

UltraMar Ferry. Bought our tickets from the Ferry vendor. Had no problems with using our return tickets at whatever time we chose. Cost was $13.00 USA per person, per trip, so a total of $26.00 per person.It is quite crowded in the morning (we went at 10am) as a lot of business people use the ferry to get to work on Cozumel.Never used the bathrooms or bought anything so can't help out there.Seats are comphy, and the ride was ok. We even had a snooze on the way back.Boarding and exiting was quick. I suggest staying on the lower level, for quick exit.The waves were quite large on the way home but they didn't seem to bother the large ferry. It took about 45 minutes each way.All in all, a pleasant way to get to the island.

Ferry to Cozumel. Just wanted to see Cozumel, not to do anything specific but wouldn't go again. Just more of the same shopping as in Playa del Carmen. The ferry was nice but confusing but there are 2 ferry lines on alternating schedules so don't buy a round trip ticket because you may go back on the other ferry.

Clean, runs on time.. UltraMar is one of two ferries (the other one being Mexico) that offered service runs between Cozumel and Playa del Carmen. It's clean, air-conditioned, and runs on time. All-in-all, it's a good deal.
Saw Jose Canesco going to Cozymel. They called up a 2nd boat when the first one was full. Nice job!

Terrifying and operators don't care and lie about conditions. It was a windy day but it wasn't storming. None of the operators warned anyone the ride ahead of us from Cozumel to Playa del Carmen would be very, very rough. Ten-foot high waves covered the boat at one point. Passing out little blue barf bags is routine for the ushers. The boat bobs and pitches and rises and falls into the sea from about five minutes into the ride until the last ten minutes. Elderly people should avoid the ferry entirely. Once in Playa del Carmen, an ambulance was called to take care of one woman who went into shock. A teenager fell off of her seat on the top deck. The operators say the ride can sometimes be more rough. They laugh about it. They treat anyone who is unhappy with disdain.
Quick (AND entertaining). We travelled to Isla de Mujeres (which we VERY much recommend) as well as Cozumel. The ferry was fast and the enterainment on board a nice addtion

Ferry to Cozumel. The ferry from Playa del Carmen to Cozuel runs often and if very fast and comfortable. It is an easy walk to the terminal from almost anywhere and purchasing the tickets there is fast. Great day trip.

tourist kiosk inside ferry terminal. We thought booking here would be smart! not the case...do not rent a scooter for cozumel from " scooters & cars " right in front of ferry terminal, no signal lights, no horn, no speedometer and seat did not latch...Mexico Tourism should address complaints if they want to improve thier Reputation, yours sincerly< JOHNNYCANOE> Manitoulin Island, Ontario, Canada...Gracious

Rough ride!. The water was rough and I think that had a lot to do with my queasiness on the ride. The trip took 45 minutes instead of the published 30. I couldn't wait to get off. I think it's the type of boat they use.
Very rough. I know its just the water but the ride is rough and be warned before you go to Cozumel if you have a weak stomack.
Fast, easy to book. Spotlessly clean, seats for all passengers with refreshments. Simliar inside to a Hovercraft with aircraft style sating

Comfortable ride...ticket sales staff could use improvement. Have used this ferry a few times going back and forth from Playa Del Carmen to Cozumel. My BIGGEST complaint is the ticket counter. Two out of the three times I purchased tickets the cashier tried to rip me off, either by overcharging when the fee was clearly printed on the board behind her head, or by short changing. On one of the trips they sold more tickets than there were seats forcing people to sit on the floor of the outer upper deck. The good points...Free wifi. Someone is always around the ticket counter with a brochure to show you your ferry schedule so you are aware of the return times. If you can get a seat there's nice comfortable seats inside with a/c, t.v's, and sometimes entertainment. They have someone come around to sell drinks. Bench seats located outside. Didn't use the washrooms.

The Way to Ferry!. It only takes about 45 minutes to ferry back and forth from Playa del Carmen to Cozumel - and granted there are only a few mass transit possibilities for doing so, but the UltraMar ferry makes the journey a comfortable one, whether you are seated below in the air conditioned, soft-seats or above in the outside on the benches. And the price for a round-trip ticket ($312 pesos) is pretty reasonable.

Bring pesos. The were orderly and a nice saafe ride to Cozumel and back. They only take cash and if you give them $20us I only got 64 pesos in change on the way there and only 56 pesos in change comeing back.That is approximately $15us each way. If you pay in pesos it is 156 which is about $12us each way.There are two companies that offer ferry service and it you get no discount for buying round trip and might have to wait awhile for your companies next boat. I traveled Ultramar both ways. wifi is really weak on the ferry, but it was better than I got anywhere else.
Ferry to Cozumel. Go to Las Palmeres for drinks and get over to Los Cincos Soles to shop
Cozumel ferries.. It's just a ferry so nothing more to say. The ferries don't appear to bother about sticking to the timetable and just leave when they feel like it!
i think is the ferry to cozumel. Just takes a little time to get there, but very cheap.

Efficient. Nothing to complain about. We have used Ultramar several times to get to Cozumel and Isla Mujeres and they are on time, friendly and good value for your money. There is usually someone entertaining on the top deck for tips but they were not pushy at all.

Very Rough ride. A few years ago we took the ferry from Cozumel to the mainland & a storm was coming in so water was very very rough, They handed you a barf bag as you got on the ferry, Im sure it is not always that way

Ferry to Cozumel. It's expensive - $17 USD each way each person, and only 1/2 ride. Of course, there's mayhem. The ships are o.k. When we came back in the late afternoon, there was a band playing, which was nice. the crew are madly trying to sell you beer/drinks/snacks the whole time.
Cozumel here we come.. Lucky enough to have a ferry ride with some awesome musicians to entertain us on the way. =)
Passenger ferry to Cozumel. Good service, but the ticket prices have gotten our of most peoples price range

Take your dramamine , and bing your nose plugs. I rode this boat about 15 years ago, and again in Feb 2012 and it was the same, very rough and rolly . I do not get sea sick, but for those who do be warned this big boat rocks and rolls. Some A#*hole decided to throw up in the garbage can rather than over the railing which caused a chain reaction. So if you get sea sick take your meds !!! A seat in the way back of the upper deck may get you wet, but a few rows in will give you fresh air while keeping you dry.

Fast way to get to mainland. This ferry runs all day like 8 am to 10 pm from Cozumel to Playa Del CarmenCosts about 25 usd per way per adult, takes about 35 to 45 mins. Ferry features outer deck and an air conditioned inside with full bar. The trip I took featured a local band playing for us, doing mainly covers, but they were good.
Ferry Trip. great trip across, coming back the ferry was to leave at 4...but late by 1/2 hour for no reason that we were told. Just keep in mind if you need to be back across at a certain time

excellent value, very safe. This is a great way to get from Playa Del Carmen to Cozumel. There are two ferry companies and one runs almost every hour from early morning to late night. The schedule is online. In Feb 2012 the cost was $13 USD one way per person. There is no need to buy a return ticket. Just buy it on your return. They are very safe, clean and comfortable. I would say they are better than the ferry system in Washington state or British Columbia. To top it off, on our return trip, a Mexican band played music all the way back. They did it all for tips.

Got to Cozumel quick and easy. decent price, left when they said they would. Tip: buy one way tickets. If you buy a round trip you are tied to a certain return time. o/w gives you the option of taking either ferry service back at a time that works for you.
Cozumel ferry. A Comfortable and fast way to get to Cozumel from Playa Carmen

Fast, Clean, On Time, No hassles. Exploria organized our Cozumel tour. They selected UltraMar as the ferry. Fast efficient boarding on the 10 AM ferry. took 35 minutes. No musicians on trip to Cozumel. windy but bright blue sunny skies and warm wind so enjoyed our seats outside. Several children with motion sickness. Take dimenhydrinate 30 minutesbefore departure if you need it. Trip back was smooth. great musicians with Spanish guitars. Memorable and hassle-free.

Nice clean ferry- but beware of a scam in operation. The bus drivers will drop unsuspecting tourists off at an UltraMar Ferry sales booth up the road from the real ferry location. The sales people at the booth will charge $3 more per person and seat you in a "waiting area". Then they will tell you that the tide is too low to land the ferry there. They will then put you on the bus again and take you to the "real" ferry location where you could have bought your tickets cheaper and not gone through this scam and wasted about 45 minutes of your time. This has to be garnering thousands of extra dollars for UltraMar each year. They should be ashamed and this should be stopped immediately by the tourist authorities. The bus drivers have to be in on this too. Beware!

The Blue and Yellow Ferry Was a Blast!!!. I was expecting rickety old boats and to be horribly ill by the time we reached Cozumel from Playa del Carmen from all the reviews I read and stories I heard. I must say I almost think they truly did not ride the ferry. We rode the blue and yellow boats which appeared to be in VERY good condition and though not new, close to it. They were clean and well maintained with three levels. The lower level was enclosed, the middle had half walls with rails across the top and open air and then the very top was very open and windy. Per recommendation, we arrived about a half hour early which gave us our choice of seating. Being late, did not leave you with many options and the top was the last to fill but this is where many of the late comers had to go while other couples and families had to split up and sit separately in seats not filled. We had roundtrip tickets but there is no savings no matter which way you do it. In each direction, we had a great band which I believe was called Laquina, who played the entire trip for us while ushers walked around offering beverages for purchase. The trip to Cozumel took 5 songs or about a half hour while the return trip only took 4 songs and seemed a lot shorter but I am sure it was not. I would have loved to ride the ferry just to hear the band continue to play and they sold CD’s which we now wish we would have purchased. The water was a bit rough this day so on the trip to Cozumel, we had taken Dramamine though we were not known to get sick. The ferry was big enough to where the motion was not overly noticeable to me – there was a band standing up playing with no problems. On the way back, I did not take Dramamine and had no problems at all. The band plays on the middle level of the boat and kept us very entertained which may have helped though too. No complaints at all about the ferry ride from us.
Too crowded. They allowed way more people than there were seats and it is Difficult to stand. Too cramped, but it got us to Cozumel!

take your dramamine. I wasnt sick, however, many many people around me were. If you are not allergic to dramamine, take it!!! It's not worth the upset stomach because all you get is a bag, not a bathroom. Its a 30-45 minute ride. Plan accordingly

Awesome. Take this Ferry across to Playa.. This ferry was great. You can sit outside or inside. They have comfy seats with air-conditioning, free wifi, a tv that plays shows, food, coffee and the boat doesn't rock as much as the other ferries. They even hand out barf bags if you need it. Great price and they get you to Cozumel from Playa in 35 mins.
rough ride. This ferry took us to Cozamel for the day. A bit of a rough ride.

Great atmosphere!. Note: I hate being on a boat when it's windy and the water is choppy.When I was traveling from Playa del Carmen to Cozumel that is exactly what happened. They did a very nice thing on my travel, not sure if they do it for all of their ferries but there was a small band that played music the entire time and got everyone on the deck to calm down (if they were like me) and sing along. I did enjoy my time on the boat with that additive.
Left on time, crew was very helpful. Location to catch the ferry is very central to all of Playas hotels/condos. Crew took good care of the bags that needed checking. (extra suitcases etc)

Go out there!. the ferry starts at 8h30 am to 10 pm every 2 hours ..go out to cozumel for a day good diving sights ! its around 24 us dollars round trip so good price for good fun (only 12min walk by the beach from the reef hotel)
Sea Sick!. Lovely ferry, comfortable and clean, but terrible crossing if you have a tendency for sea sickness.
easy. comfortable seats, easy and affordable. Seas were rough but not their fault.
Excellent. They run every hour back and forth from Cozumel to Playa

Very efficient. There are two ferry companies going to and from playa del carmen and to cozumel. Ultramar Ferry is one of them. Prices are reasonable but buy a one way ticket because the two companies alternate their route times and you can take either to come back and you dont save any money for buying a round tip. They are clean and large enough to provide service for pretty much everyone. There is seating inside and outside and they sell drinks and snacks aboard but the ride there is very short

top day trip tip. First up its a modern ferry however as another review stated somtimes with live music, we had a 4 piece band doing a selection of latin classics - the brasilians loved it!If you are going for a day trip DO NOT BUY A RETURN TICKET get two singles.Its the same price but it gives you more flexability.There are two companies that run the rout each sail on alternative hoursif you decide you want to go back at 3 then just buy the single ticket from the company that sails at 3.

Efficient and on-time. Everything you'd want from a ferry service from the Yucatan Mainland to the off-shore islands. These ferries are clean, reliable and good value for money. Sometimes they even have Mexican entertainment on board!

Great ferry service. Went from Cozumel to Playa on the larger of the ferries they had. Very easy walked up to window on the pier put down visa/master card and for $12.50 each we were on our way. They do briefly "look" at your carry on and put our big backpacks on board separate like a plane. Have a snack bar on board, we took our own water. On the way back you have to buy tickets about 100 yards up the street from the pier on the north side in a little building. We came back on the 10:00pm. While we were waiting you could listen to the live music from Senior Frogs which is next to the pier. On the way back they used the "open" ferry so you could either site inside or out in the air. Beautiful moon lit night.
Very modern and clean. It was on time, modern & Göran. Felt like a vety good alternative.

Good ride... Buy the one way ticket to Cozumel, we bought roundtrip at were not coming back till the 5pm ferry but we were ready to come back at 4pm.. so if you buy one way you can buy a ticket back with another company that is a few dollars cheaper..
Great Value. This is a fast comfortable way to go between Playa Del Carmen and Cozumel.Try em you like it.

Efficient Transport to Islands. We used the fwrry to both Couzmel and Isla de Majores. The ferry to Isla had free wi-fi, which was a bonus to do a quick download of mail. Also, at their port facility in Cancun, there was aple, safe good parking at a very reasonable price.

Brace yourself. We took the UltraMar from Playa del Carmen to Cozumel at 10am. We were at the end of a very long line of people so we got terrible seats. My reccommendation would be to NOT take this boat, however if you are going to do it, wait and be the first people on the boat so you can get a seat on the top deck with air. We were on the top deck by it was enclosed and we were facing a wall. Even at 10am it was terribly hot and there was no air circulation where we were. The boat ride was VERY ROUGH. I am typically rock solid on boats, but this one made me somewhat quesy because it is such a long ride. We learned our lesson for the ride back and got a seat on the top that was open and even though it was still quite rough, it was much more tolerable.
The most comfortable way to Cancun from Playa. Only leaves on the hour, so timing is important. Be on time as they leave promptly.
The Best. The best ferry to Cozumel, faster, cleaner and better than the other company.

Smooth Sailing. We've traveled to Cozumel almost every year that we go to Playa Del Carmen. We always use UltraMar. The ships are very clean. Decent bathrooms aboard. A beverage and snack bar as well. They view movies or videos to keep you entertained during your crossing. They have a decent amount of times to choose to travel to Cozumel and also to return to Playa.

enroute to Cozumel. the trip across was fine, however the day visit to Cozumel was a waste of time, nothing of interest, even the natural enviroment was not worth seeing or experiencing. and the food - not edible.

Don't buy round trip tickets!. Two ferry companies operate on this route leaving on alternatiing schedules. They will automatically try to charge you for a round trip. There is no discount for purchasing a round trip, it simply restricts when you can return. If you by a one way ticket, you can return when you want. Aside from this, the service is fine. There isn't much in Cozumel unless you are planning on snorkleing.

DO NOT GET A TOUR- Take the Ferry. UltraMar Ferry is quick, affordable, and very convenient. They have wi-fi on their ships, so you can even research activities on your way there. I always take the ferry to Cozumel and then just take a taxi to spots where there is coral reef (easily findable online). In total, I end up paying about $300 pesos (20 something dollars) for my round trip and I get to spend as much time as I want on the island, as opposed to $50+ dollars for a "tour" where they take you to spots in the ocean crowded with other snorkelers, and leave you there for about 20 minutes (even though they claim it will be 40). You get to choose your own time, your own food, your schedule, everything. Definitely the way to go.

Great except for the band on the upper deck. We took the UltraMar ferry from Playa Del Carmen to Cozumel. The cost for a ticket is 26 USD round trip per person, hang on to your ticket for the trip back and make sure that you check the schedule. Do not make the same mistake that we made of sitting on the upper deck because they have a band that plays really loud music and that with the movement of the boat is more than enough to make you sick and give you a headache. As usual, the band asks you for tips or to buy their CD during the boat ride - we were hoping that we wouldn't be subjected to this on the way back but no such luck. The best part of the ferry is how quick it gets you from point A to point B, it is on time and it looks very sea-worthy.

You may be seasick!. We took the ferry to Cozumel on a very choppy day, and nicknamed the boat the Ultra Barf! Almost every other passenger was sick, and the ferry staff had a heck of time handing out barf bags in sufficient quantities. What a job! Having said that, they were very accomodating. They made the rounds constantly during the 30 minute trip, even fanning and rubbing the backs of the poor souls who continued to feel ill for the whole trip. For about $15 CDN, you get a live band and can purchase cold drinks and snacks if you can keep them down!
Speedy and comfortable. Easy trip. No discount for round trip so go one-way as others suggest.

Good expeience. Always enjoy the quick trip to Cozumel on ultrMar ferry. There is bar service on board and sometimes entertainment. During peak seasons it can get busy and there can be long lineups so plan ahead overall good experience

Get the sick bucket .... I was so looking forward to this trip to Cozumel but as soon as we set off I began throwing up & I'm hardly ever sick. In fact I'm 50 years of age & have only ever thrown up half a dozen times in my entire life. God this was so rough! I'm not sure if it was the time of year or what. Maybe it's calmer in the summer? The girls were great as they rushed up & down with sick bags & tissue, & stuff to sniff, although I almost popped it in my mouth as my husband said it was a mint! Well done girls you do a fantastic job! I sat at the front bottom deck going & the waves were thrashing hight above my window. On the return journey I sat in the middle (inside) at the top & was almost sick but took deep breaths & managed not to be. It's such a shame as I love a ferry trip. The music that was outside was good but ever so loud.
Nice boat servicing islands in the area. I really enjoy the quick trip over to the islands in the area and they have a bar on board too. It's the best way to island hop in the area.

Be careful of the waves as you will likely get sick!. My wife and I made a day trip to go to Cozumel and decided to take the Ferry and did regret it. For those of you who have a weak stomach, you have been forewarned...you will likely get sick on the Ferry. If I was aware of this, I would have thought twice before going but honestly did not anticipate the amount of rocking of the Ferry due to the high waves (yes, it was like any other regular day here in Playa Del Carmen).It is about a 45 minute ride each way and while it can be a pleasant experience, I do not recommend it for those who can get sea sick quickly. As you enter, they will hand out plastic throw up bags to everyone and on our trip there and return many did throw up except the locals who are likely used to it.Tip: Would not recommend on travelling on Sunday as many places are closed in Cozumel and if you decide to go, sit on the lower level as it tends to rock less than the upper level.
trip to the past. We have stayed many times in Cozumel & enjoyed seeing how it has blossomed!

Don't buy round trip tickets!. My mother in law and her husband went to Cozumel on Friday 15th 2011. They decided to buy round trip tickets and had the most awful experience with Ultramar. They saw the schedule online the night before however it was totally different from what they offer at the box offer at the time they came back from Cozumel. They had to come back with another company TO AVOID TO WAIT 2-3 HOURS and had to pay another ticket. We spoke with Miguel (Manager in Playa) who has no customer skills and did not care what happended to us. He has poor skills when dealing with this situations. I guess the moral of the story is Do not buy a round trip tickets because you will be surprise when coming back.

Easy way to get to Cozumel. While you will be approached by everyone to buy tickets from them, you should really buy at the ferry, since there are two companies and they come and go at different times. I'd also just buy one way so you're not locked into a return company. That paid off for me b/c I got sick during the day and we were forced to return earlier than we had initially planned.Loading and unloading was fine, but a little slow as there were only two exits doors. You're "forced" to watch advertisements on video the entire way, but you can tune them out. There is food and drink on board.

quick ride, but traveling with a small dog, you are required to go up top. On the ride back we were all tired, and salty after a day of diving. Yet here was a great band on the level we were at. Enjoyed the ride even more
Cozumel Ferry. Great service over to Cozumel. Very straight forward and easy to book yourselves. Buy single tickets because you may not be able to get back with the same company

no other public transport. is the only way to go to Isla Mujeres from Cancun and from Playa to Cozumel and cancun form zona hotelera you must take a taxi is good goes all day long but en playa the last one is at 5 pm
incredible trip!. sailing thru caribbean blue water has no comparison, just great!
one of two ferrys boats between Playa and Cozumel. Both ferry companies have comfortable clean fun transportation of large ferry boats with inside or topside outside seating
Easy travel. Plenty of seats. Great way to visit Cozumel. They had beverage service and was $28.00 for a RT ticket.
took to Cozumel. Its a ferry--what more can i say. Transpoortation from Playa to Cozumel. Ferry was FULL, however quite smooth ride and takes approx 30 min to get there.
Ferry with a bar. Fun ride to Conzumel. The ferry was packed but we enjoyed the trip.

Fast service to the Island.. We last rode on the ferry from Cozumel to PDC in 1996 and wow have they ever upgraded the ferries since then. I thought the price was reasonable at $14 a person each way. The ride took about 40 minutes and was a mixture of smooth and rough, the company can't control the waves. One woman next to me was turning greener than the color of her dress and could not get off the boat fast enough.We enjoyed the ride and would utilize this company the next time we are in either PDC or Cozumel. Just avoid all the people on the piers on both sides trying to persuade you to go to their restaurant, car rental agency, etc.

Smooth operator. Got the ferry over to Cozumel on a very wet and windy day. Dreading it but had lodgings booked. Need not have worried -smooth crossing on a clean and comfortable craft.Ticket purchase easy and ferry Bang on time.
Nice trip. It was raining but the trip itself was smoother than others we had.

Excellent Service. When we travelled to Cozumel from Playa del Carment the boat was clean, we got a seat and listened to a very good band which were playing during the crossing. Worthwhile doing and much cheaper than trips arranged by holiday reps.

Queasy Ride. As we made our way to buy our tickets, we faced a gauntlet of vendors near the ticket booth who were trying to sell us excursion tours. There were so many of them and they were a bit aggressive so that part was really annoying.The ferry itself is clean, air conditioned with comfortable seats, and has free wi-fi. They also sell snacks and drinks including beers and margaritas. There is a clean bathroom on board. The ride was approx 30 minutes. We were dropped off near the shopping area in Cozumel so that was convenient.On our way back, the ride was super rocky. The ferry was swaying side to side almost the whole time. I'm not normally prone to motion sickness, but this was the worst ride of my life. Just two days prior, we took a fishing boat from Cancun to Isla Mujeres that was a smoother ride than this. Anyway, I held on, but my friend got sick.. Luckily, she was near a waste basket. Since the ride made us sick, we were unable to go out in Playa del Carmen. That was too bad because it dropped us off right in front of Senor Frogs and I really wanted to go there.

Best way to get from PDC to Cozumel. Price for the ferry was $11 USD per person each way. Was great to sit outside as they had entertainment and food/drinks available to purchase. If you are sitting on the outside looking over the water, be aware of water splashing up into the boat, its kind of refreshing. The inside of the boat is nicely air conditioned as well. Its a short trip but quite enjoyable.

Ferri is clean, fast and comfortable. The only way to go by ship to Cozumel there are two companies but both are good and safe.It takes about 45 minutes to cross from Playa del Carmen to Cozumel.If you get seasick you better stay on the lower deck in the middle as far back as possible. It is well ventilated and has a great air conditioner

No nonsense transportation. Trip from Playa to Cozumel is $15 US, the only reason that i wanted to make sure to mention, there are is another ferry, and just make sure that if you are heading to Cozumel to snorkle, you mgith be better off, buying the return ticket at Cozumel, otherwise, you might have to wait around another hour, if you buy a round trip ticket. Time to reach Cozumel or Playa is approx. 25 minutes. They also sell some drinks and beers on board. Ferry drops you off in front of Market in Cozumel. Try to go shopping in Cozumel when the ships are NOT in, otherwise, you will pay premium prices.

Nice ferry...very clean.... Nice ferry ride to and from Playa del Carmen. The band that plays is a little loud, but not bad at all. The band is very talented and will play requests. The ride is about 45 minutes, and is very relaxed.

Do not take Ultramar ferry! They fool tourists. On February 14th I was boarding the Ultramar ferry. I left my luggage to the Ultramar employees in charged of putting my luggage onboard, they put a band with an identification number and they handed me the ticket with the same number to claim the luggage on the other side. Once in Cozumel, these employees put the luggage on a trolley while passengers were disembarking the boat. I was checking every single luggage put on the moving band from the trolley, anxious to get to my hotel and relax. I noticed there was an employee at the exit of the luggage claim area checking everybody’s claim ticket to make sure no one leaves with a luggage that does not belong to them. My luggage did not appear even after the trolley was emptied. I quickly notified the responsible from Ultramar on site. He communicated with the quay in Playa del Carmen, my luggage was nowhere to be found. I gave them the cell phone number where they could reach me in case they find it.I had to go to the hotel without a thing. I never received a call from them. Two days after, when I could finally get in touch with a higher responsible from Ultramar, I was accused to have orchestrated everything to have my luggage stolen and then claim it! I still have the claiming ticket in y possession but no luggage and still no compensation from Ultramar.I had to go to have a police report because my passport was inside my luggage. There they explained me that often the company’s own employees steal and unfortunately there is no way to prove it. Do not take Ultramar. They fool tourists.

Its a ferry. This is not an attraction... its a ferry from playa del carmen to cozumel. The bad was loud, but there werent bad. I had no issues what-so ever with the experience other than it was just a ferry. If you want to get to/from cozumel... its a must. ITs only a 30 min ride, so no matter what happens, its only 30 min.

Avoid. I was boarding the ferry in Playa del Carmen it was raining a little the ferry was moving a little there were 4 people standing there no one helped me the gangway was in poor shape I slipped and fell broke my ankle, they asked me to move out of the way so they could continue boarding people, I felt they could have helped more.

ferry to isla mujeres ULTRAMAR!!!!. from this place you can cross to isla mujeres, theres two companies, el mexicano and ultramar ferry, DONT TAKE EL MEXICANO!!! their boats are really in a bad shape and it takes forever to get to isla, they are both the same price but ultramar ferry are totally way better, and theres no charge for the parking, by the way ultramar its on the left side, the yellow company not the green onei went the fist time with el mexicano, but everyone wqas puking, cuz its a long ride, the second time i went with ultramar and it was only 20 minutes, was great

Get on the boat early so you can get a seat away from the "band". Yes, this is an incredibly inexpensive way to get to and from Cozumel and Playa del Carmen. Just make sure you get on board early enough to get a seat downsairs (or inside on the upper deck). The ferry company provides "entertainment" on the upper (outside) deck. It's 3 guys banging on drums and trying to sing for the entire 45 mnute trip. These gentlemen aren't musicians . . . . they are pure auditory pain! You will be miserable after the first 10 minutes of this noise. At the end of the ferry trip, you will be downright ready to jump overboard.
